name: Financial Assistance To Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)
description: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. Under the scheme, financial assistance will be provided to such school dropouts to pursue SSLC, +1, +2 equivalent courses implemented by State Literacy Mission. A person becomes disabled by birth or because of an accident or disease. The differently-abled persons face many hurdles in their day-to-day life. About 90% of disabled persons may not have received even primary education. They are forced to give up studies due to various factors, such as difficulty in going to educational institutions and inadequate road facilities.

faqs.question: What is the “Financial Assistance to Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)” scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance will be provided to such school dropouts (differently-abled students) to pursue SSLC, +1, +2 equivalent courses implemented by State Literacy Mission.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The differently abled students with 40% or more disability are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Which classes students will be eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The students who are pursuing SSLC, +1, +2 equivalent courses will be eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for differently abled students?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for differently abled students.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: Will only BPL category applicant be eligible for financial assistance?
faqs.answer: No, financial assistance will be provided to students falling in Above Poverty Line (APL) as well as Below Poverty Line (BPL) categories.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance (For course fees, Exam fees, Registration fees & Admission fees) will be provided to differently-abled students to continue their education.

faqs.question: Where can I get the application form?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit the nearest Anganwadi Centre or District Social Justice Office and collect the application form. faqs.question: Where shall I submit the application form?
faqs.answer: The application may be submitted to the District Social Justice Officers (DSJOs) or the concerned Anganwadi Centre.

name: Snehasanthwanam
description: The Government of Kerala has launched the “Snehasanthwanam” scheme under the Kerala Social Security Mission. The scheme acts as a relief measure for the Endosulfan victims in the state of Kerala. Under this scheme, financial assistance has been granted from December 2010 onwards to the Endosulfan victims. This scheme also aims to provide educational assistance to the Children of Endosulfan-affected families. In addition to this, Kerala Social Security Mission is now providing monthly assistance of ₹700/- per month to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme.
benefits: Under the scheme

financial assistance of ₹2200/- is given to the bedridden Endosulfan victims.Financial assistance of ₹1700/- is given to such bedridden Endosulfan victims who are getting ₹300/- per month as a disability pension.All other Endosulfan victims are given ₹1200/- based on the list furnished by the District Collector.In addition to this

monthly assistance of ₹700/- is given to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme.Educational assistance will be provided to the Children of Endosulfan affected families as under:      a)	Children studying in buds school – ₹ 2000/-.      b)	Children studying in Class 1st to 7th – ₹2000/-.      c)	Children studying in Class 8th to 10th – ₹3000/-.      d)	Children studying in Plus One and Plus Two – ₹4000/-.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.The applicant should be an Endosulfan victim.

if required

faqs.question: What is the “Snehasanthwanam” scheme?
faqs.answer: The Government of Kerala has launched the “Snehasanthwanam” scheme under the Kerala Social Security Mission. The scheme acts as a relief measure for the Endosulfan victims in the state of Kerala. Under this scheme, financial assistance has been granted from December 2010 onwards to the Endosulfan victims. This scheme also aims to provide educational assistance to the Children of Endosulfan-affected families. In addition to this, Kerala Social Security Mission is now providing monthly assistance of ₹700/- per month to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme.

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of this scheme is to give some relief to the Endosulfan victims in the state by providing financial assistance to them.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is given to the bedridden Endosulfan victims?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹2200/- is given to the bedridden Endosulfan victims.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is given to such bedridden Endosulfan victims who are getting ₹300/- per month as a disability pension?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹1700/- is given to such bedridden Endosulfan victims who are getting ₹300/- per month as a disability pension.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is given to the all other Endosulfan?
faqs.answer: All other Endosulfan victims are given ₹1200/- based on the list furnished by the District Collector.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is given to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme?
faqs.answer: Monthly assistance of ₹700/- is given to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme.

faqs.question: How much educational assistance is given to the Children of Endosulfan affected families?
faqs.answer:
Educational assistance will be provided to the Children of Endosulfan affected families as under:

      b)	Children studying in Class 1st to 7th – ₹2000/-.
      c)	Children studying in Class 8th to 10th – ₹3000/-.
      d)	Children studying in Plus One and Plus Two – ₹4000/-.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be an Endosulfan victim.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: How can an applicant avail of the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the application duly filled out should be submitted to the Kasaragod District Collector Office.

name: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)
description: The scheme “Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)” was started by the Department of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. faqs.question: How Can I apply for scholarship, if I am a student of Institute, located outside the Union Territory of Andaman & Nicobar Islands?

faqs.question: Can I Secure scholarship for previous year?

name: National Family Benefit Scheme - Uttar Pradesh
description: DetailedThe NFBS also known as Rashtriya Parivarik Labh Yojana was started by the UP government on in January 2016. Under this scheme, the families who have lost their lead earners will get a lump sum amount of money as compensation. To claim the compensation one must have applied to register under the scheme. The entire application process is available only online. There is no provision of offline application for the scheme. ﻿Key FeaturesThe NFBS scheme is for below-poverty-line families. If the lead earner of the family has lost his/ her life, the next head of the family will get financial assistance from the state government of Uttar Pradesh.The applicant should be aged between 18 years to 60 years. If the applicant is below 18 i.e. minor or above 60 that is old, then the applicant might not get the compensation amount.The amount of the compensation is fixed at Rs. 30, 000/- which has increased from the earlier amount of compensation which is Rs. 20, 000/-. To apply for the scheme one must use the online process. The scheme does not have any offline mode of registration.To avail the scheme, the yearly income of the family should not be more than Rs. 56, 450/- in urban areas and Rs. 46, 080/- in rural areas. The amount of compensation will be provided to the families only after the death of the lead earner or the only earning member of the family.
benefits: BenefitsUnder the this scheme the government will pay Rs. 30
000/- per family as compensation. The amount of the compensation was Rs. 20
000/- earlier. After 2013
the amount was revised and become Rs. 30

000/-. Under this scheme anyone who is eligible to become the head of the family after the death of the earner can apply for the scheme and claim the mentioned amount as compensation from the government.
eligibility_criteria: Eligibility To apply for the scheme one must be living under the poverty line. The applicant should not be aged less than 18 years or above 60 years. The family income of the applicant should not be more than Rs. 56
450/- if the family is from the urban area and Rs. 46
080/- if the family is from the rural area. Support will be provided to the family after the death of the only earner of the family.

faqs.question: Is the scholarship paid during the internship or practical training in certain courses?
faqs.answer: No, scholarships are not paid during internships in MBBS courses or during practical training in other courses if the student receives remuneration or an allowance.

faqs.question: Are students expected to purchase textbooks with their maintenance allowance?
faqs.answer: Yes, students are expected to purchase textbooks, stationery, etc., out of their maintenance allowance.

faqs.question: What if a student secures admission after the 20th day of a month?
faqs.answer: If a student secures admission after the 20th day of a month, the scholarship amount will be paid from the following month.

faqs.question: What is the payment schedule for maintenance charges?
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges are payable from 1st April or the month of admission, whichever is later, to the month when examinations are completed.

faqs.question: Can students switch courses and still receive the scholarship?
faqs.answer: If a student is promoted to the next higher class, they will be entitled to the scholarship for the promoted class, provided they are otherwise eligible.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for scholars who can't appear in an annual exam due to illness or unforeseen events?
faqs.answer: Yes, if a scholar cannot appear in an annual exam due to illness or unforeseen events, the scholarship may be renewed for the next academic year with the submission of required proofs.

faqs.question: How is the scholarship duration determined?
faqs.answer: Scholarships are tenable from the stage at which they are awarded until the completion of the course, provided the scholar maintains good conduct and regular attendance.

faqs.question: Are students studying in another state eligible for scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, students belonging to one state but studying in another state are eligible and will receive scholarships from the state to which they belong.

faqs.question: How much are thesis typing/printing charges covered by the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Thesis typing/printing charges are covered up to a maximum of Rs. 1000, based on the recommendation of the Head of the Institution.

faqs.question: What expenses are covered by the study tour charges?
faqs.answer: Study tour charges cover transportation expenses, up to a maximum of Rs. 900 per annum.

faqs.question: Are refundable deposits like caution money included in the scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, refundable deposits like caution money are excluded from the scholarship coverage.

name: Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana
description: The scheme “Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana (ABVKY)” was introduced by the Employees’ State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) on a pilot basis for a period of 2 years w.e.f. 01.07.2018 for providing relief to the Insured Persons (IPs) who have become unemployed. Under this scheme relief in the form of cash compensation to the extent of 50% of the average per day earnings was paid up to a maximum of 90 days of unemployment subject to conditions that the employee should have completed two years of Insurable employment and has contributed not less than Seventy-Eight (78) days in each of the three consecutive contribution periods immediately preceding to the claim of the relief.

faqs.answer:
•	The Insured Person (IP) should have been rendered unemployed during the period the relief is claimed.
•	The Insured Person should have been in insurable employment for a minimum period of two years.
•	The Insured Person should have contributed not less than 78 days during each of the preceding four contribution periods.
•	The contribution in respect of him/her should have been paid or payable by the employer.
•	The unemployment contingency should not have resulted from any punishment for misconduct, superannuation, or voluntary retirement.
•	The Aadhaar and Bank Account of the Insured Person should be linked with the insured person database.

faqs.question: What are the conditions for the Disqualification/Termination of relief under ABVKY?
faqs.answer:
1.	During lockout
2.	Strike resorted to by the employees declared illegal by the competent authority
3.	Voluntary abandonment of employment/ voluntary retirement/ premature retirement
4.	Less than two years of contributory service
5.	On attaining the age of superannuation
6.	Convicted (i.e. punished for false statement) under the provisions of Section 84 of the ESI Act read with Rule 62 of the ESI (Central) Rule 
7.	On being re-employed elsewhere during the period he/she is in receipt of Relief under ABVKY
8.	Dismissal/termination under disciplinary action 
9.	On the death of IP

faqs.question: What are the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer:
•	The scheme provides relief to the extent of 50% of the average per day earnings of employees during their last employment.
•	The relief amount to be paid up to a maximum of 90 days of unemployment subject to conditions that the employee should have completed two years of Insurable employment and has contributed not less than Seventy-Eight (78) days in each of the three consecutive contribution periods.

faqs.question: What is the minimum employment period required to be eligible for Unemployment Insurance?
faqs.answer: The insured person should have been in insurable employment for a minimum period of two years immediately before their unemployment.

faqs.question: How many days of contribution are required in the contribution period preceding unemployment?
faqs.answer: The insured person should have contributed for not less than 78 days in the contribution period immediately preceding the unemployment.

faqs.question: Are there any additional contribution requirements in the two years prior to unemployment?
faqs.answer: Yes, in addition to the 78 days in the immediate preceding contribution period, the insured person must also have a minimum of 78 days of contribution in one of the remaining three contribution periods within the two years prior to unemployment.

faqs.question: When does an Unemployment Insurance claim become due?
faqs.answer: An Unemployment Insurance claim becomes due 30 days after the date of unemployment.

faqs.question: Can an individual covered under the ESI scheme be considered unemployed if working for more than one employer?
faqs.answer: No, under the ESI scheme, an individual working for multiple employers will be considered unemployed only if they are rendered unemployed with all employers simultaneously.

faqs.question: What happens if an individual covered under the ESI scheme is unemployed with only one of the multiple employers?
faqs.answer: If an individual covered under the ESI scheme is unemployed with only one of the multiple employers, they will not be considered unemployed for the purposes of ESI benefits. Unemployment status is determined when an individual is unemployed with all employers simultaneously under the scheme.

faqs.question: Do all Insured Persons covered under the ESI Act need to register separately to avail themselves of the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: No, all Insured Persons covered under the ESI Act are automatically entitled to the scheme benefits, and no separate registration is required. The entitlement is based on the coverage under the ESI Act, and eligible individuals are granted access to the benefits without the need for additional registration.

faqs.question: Does the scheme cover the IPs who was unemployed during the lockdown but are now working?
faqs.answer: Such employees, if fulfil the required eligibility conditions are eligible for relief under the scheme. But the claimant must have been unemployed during the period of claim.

faqs.question: What is the age of superannuation?
faqs.answer: The age of superannuation of any insured person is company specific as per company’s policy in accordance with law. As per the explanation under Section 56 of the ESI Act the age of superannuation can be taken as age of sixty years.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The application for the claims benefits can be made online at website www.esic.in along with submission of the physical claim with an affidavit, photocopy of Aadhaar Card and Bank Account details to the designated ESIC Branch Office by post or in person.

name: NSAP - Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
description: The scheme "Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS)" is one of the five sub-schemes of the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP). Under IGNOAPS, citizens living Below Poverty Line and 60 years or above in age are eligible to apply. A monthly pension of ₹ 200 up to 79 years and ₹ 500 thereafter.The Government of India, on 15th August 1995, introduced the National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP) as a fully funded Centrally Sponsored Scheme targeting the destitute, defined as any person who has little or no regular means of subsistence from his / her own source of income or through financial support from family members or other sources, to be identified by the States and UTs, with the objective of providing a basic level of financial aid. NSAP is being administered by the Ministry of Rural Development. This program is being implemented in rural areas as well as urban areas. NSAP represents a significant step towards the fulfillment of the Directive Principles of State Policy enshrined in the Constitution of India which enjoin upon the State to undertake within its means a number of welfare measures. These are intended to secure for the citizen's adequate means of livelihood, raise the standard of living, improve public health, provide free and compulsory education for children, etc. The NSAP at present includes five sub-schemes as its components - a) Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS)b) Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS)c) Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS)d) National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS)e) Annapurna SchemeObjectives of NSAP - 1. Provides social assistance benefits to poor households in the case of death, maternity, or old age of the breadwinner.2. Ensure minimum national standards, in addition to the benefits, the States are currently providing or might provide in the future.3. Ensure uniform social protection to the beneficiaries across the country without interruption.Expansion to cover all eligible BPL persons - In 2007, the scheme was expanded to cover all eligible persons Below Poverty Line (BPL).
benefits: A monthly pension of ₹ 200 up to 79 years and ₹ 500 thereafter.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be living Below Poverty Line.The applicant should be at least 60 years of age.
required_documents: Duly filled and self-attested Application Form (proforma given the annexures of the scheme guidelines).Domicile Certificate                                                                                                  Residential Proof (Voter card/ Electricity Bill/Aadhar Card)                                                    Age Proof (Birth Certificate issued by the School last attended or Municipal authority or SHO or through Medical Board)                                             Aadhar Number                                                                                            Bank Passbook                                                                                                                Ration Card                                                                                                                        Affidavit duly attested by Judicial Magistrate/Executive Magistrate that she/he is not in receipt of any pension/ financial assistance from any other source﻿

faqs.question: What Does NSAP Stand For And When Was It Launched?
faqs.answer: NSAP stands for National Social Assistance Programme. NSAP was launched on 15th August 1995.

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of NSAP?
faqs.answer: In providing social assistance benefits to poor households in the case of old age, death of the breadwinner, and maternity, the NSAP aims at ensuring minimum national standards, in addition to the benefits that the States are currently providing or might provide in future. It also aims at ensuring that social protection to the beneficiaries everywhere in the country is uniformly available without interruption.

faqs.question: What Are The Components Of NSAP?
faqs.answer:
The NSAP at its inception in 1995 had three components namely (1) National Old Age Pension Scheme (NOAPS, (2) National Family Benefit Scheme (NFBS), and (3) National Maternity Benefit Scheme (NMBS). The National Maternity Benefit Scheme (NMBS) was subsequently transferred on 1st April, 2001 from the Ministry of Rural development to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

On 1st April 2000 a new Scheme known as Annapurna Scheme was launched. This scheme aimed at providing food security to meet the requirement of those senior citizens who, though eligible, have remained uncovered under the NOAPS.

In February 2009, two new Schemes known as Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS) and Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS) were introduced.

Presently NSAP comprises of five schemes, namely - (1) Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS), (2) Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS), (3) Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS), (4) National Family Benefit Scheme NFBS) and (5) Annapurna.

faqs.question: Who Implements NSAP?
faqs.answer: The NSAP is implemented in the States/UTs in accordance with the general conditions applicable to all components of the NSAP as well as specific conditions applicable to each component. The NSAP Schemes are mainly implemented by the Social Welfare Departments in the States. But NSAP is implemented by Rural Development Department in the States of Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Goa, Meghalaya and West Bengal; by the Department of Women & Child Development in Orissa and Puducherry; by the Revenue Department in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu and by the Department of Labour Employment & Training in Jharkhand. The NSAP extends to both the rural as well as urban areas

faqs.question: What Is The Basic Eligibility Criterion Under NSAP?
faqs.answer: For getting benefits under NSAP the applicant must belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family according to the criteria prescribed by the Govt. of India.

faqs.question: How Are The Beneficiaries Identified In Rural Areas?
faqs.answer: As per the revised eligibility criteria, new beneficiaries will be identified from the BPL list prepared by the States/UTs as per guidelines issued by the Ministry of Rural Development (MORD) for the BPL Census 2002.

faqs.question: How Will The Identification Of The Beneficiaries Be Done In The Urban Areas?
faqs.answer: Identification of eligible beneficiaries will be carried out as per the BPL list required to be prepared in connection with the poverty alleviation program off the ministry of Urban Housing and Poverty Alleviation.

faqs.question: What Will Be The Position In Respect Of Existing Beneficiaries, Whose Names Are Not On The BPL List?
faqs.answer: They will continue to get the pension as at present without any interruption notwithstanding the fact that their names are not borne on the BPL list, provided they were eligible as per the old criteria.

faqs.question: What Is The Funding Pattern Envisaged Under NSAP?
faqs.answer: Under NSAP 100 percent Central Assistance is extended to the States/UTs to provide the benefits in accordance with the norms, guidelines, and conditions laid down by the Central Government.

faqs.question: What Is The Eligibility For Getting A Pension Under IGNOAPS?
faqs.answer:
The eligibility criteria under Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS) is - 
The age of the applicant (male or female) should be 60 years or above.
The applicant should belong to a household living below the poverty line according to the criteria prescribed by the Govt. of India

faqs.question: How Is IGNOAPS Different From The Earlier National Old Age Pension Scheme (NOAPS)?
faqs.answer: Under NOAPS, old age pensions were granted to a person who is 65 years old or higher and who is destitute in the sense of having little or no means of regular income. Pension under IGNOAPS is now granted to a person who is 60 years or above and belongs to a household below the poverty line instead of only to destitute.

faqs.question: When Did The IGNOAPS Come Into Effect?
faqs.answer: The National Old Age Pension Scheme has been renamed as Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOPS) and was formally launched on 19th November 2007.

faqs.question: What Is The Pension Amount Under Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme? Whether Pension Is Restricted To Only One Person In A Family?
faqs.answer:
The central contribution of pension under the Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS) is Rs. 200/- per month per beneficiary up to 79 years and Rs.500/- per month per beneficiary from 80 year onwards and the State Governments may contribute over and above to this amount. At present old age beneficiaries are getting anywhere between Rs. 200/- to Rs. 1000/- depending on the State Contribution.
All the persons who are 60 years of age in a BPL family are eligible to get an old age pension.

Under this scheme, a pension is provided to elderly citizens above the age of 60 years belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category and the beneficiary will receive a monthly pension of ₹ 1500/-, ₹ 2000/- & ₹ 2500/- as per eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What should be the monthly pension under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will receive a sum of ₹1500/-, ₹ 2,000/- & ₹2500/- as monthly pension under this scheme as per their eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: How long will a beneficiary receive a monthly pension under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will get a pension as long as he/she is alive.

faqs.question: What is the age limit under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should have attained the age of 60 years.

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable for both husband & wife?
faqs.answer: In case both the husband & wife are old age persons and are eligible for Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS), only one member of the family shall be awarded the pension. In case of death of the pensioner, such pension shall be transferred to his/her spouse, if alive on surrender of the pass book, provided he/she has attained the age of 60 (sixty) years of age or more.

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable only for Below Poverty Line (BPL) category?
faqs.answer: Yes, only a member of the BPL family of Sikkim state is eligible under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is a person drawing any other pension under Central / State Government or from any other sources eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, any person drawing any other pension under Central / State Government or from any other sources is not eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the mode of filling application?
faqs.answer: The applicant may fill application both online & offline mode.

faqs.question: How can I register under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Please visit the online portal link: https://pensionscheme.sikkim.gov.in and use the “Create Account” button to reach the registration page. Complete registration requirements as appropriate and click the “Register” button to register and then login.

faqs.question: How will the pension distributed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The pension shall be distributed through Direct Benefit Transfer System or any other system as may be decided by the Sanctioning / Competent Authority from time to time.

faqs.question: Should I need to submit "Life Certificate" every year?
faqs.answer: Yes, each beneficiary of the Pensions should submit a "Life Certificate" in the prescribed format in the month of November every year failing which it will be presumed that the beneficiary is either died or migrated outside the State of Sikkim and the payment of pension shall be stopped forthwith without further notice.

faqs.question: When was the scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched in the year 1986.

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Scheduled caste farmers for purchasing agricultural land, thereby enhancing their income through self-cultivation.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided per acre under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Scheduled caste farmers are provided with ₹1,00,000/- per acre to purchase agricultural land.

faqs.question: What is the maximum assistance provided for land purchase?

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?

faqs.question: Is the assistance available for purchasing land only from the government?

faqs.question: How can eligible applicants apply for the scheme?

faqs.question: Can individuals residing outside Gujarat apply for this scheme?

name: Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme
description: Launched in August 2008, Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a credit-linked subsidy scheme, administered by the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME). PMEGP aims to generate employment opportunities through the establishment of micro-enterprises in the non-farm sector for rural as well as urban areas. The scheme has been approved for continuation over the 15th Finance Commission cycle i.e., for the period of five years from 2021-22 to 2025-26. PMEGP was formed by merging the two schemes that were in operation till 31st March 2008, namely Prime Minister's Rojgar Yojana (PMRY) and Rural Employment Generation Programme (REGP). An outlay of ₹13,554.42 Crore has been approved for PMEGP for five Financial Years (2021-22 to 2025-26) to set up about 4,00,000 projects with the creation of 30,00,000 employment @8 persons per unit). In addition, 1,000 Units will be upgraded in each FY. ObjectivesTo generate employment opportunities in rural as well as urban areas of the country through the setting up of new self-employment ventures/projects/micro enterprises. To bring together widely dispersed traditional artisans! rural and urban unemployed youth and give them self-employment opportunities to the extent possible, at their place. To provide continuous and sustainable employment to a large segment of traditional and prospective artisans and rural and urban unemployed youth in the country, so as to help arrest migration of rural youth to urban areas. To increase the wage-earning capacity of workers and artisans and contribute to an increase in the growth rate of rural and urban employment.Implementing AgenciesAt the National level, the scheme is being implemented by the Khadi and Village Industries Commission (KVIC), a statutory organization under the administrative control of the Ministry of MSME as the single nodal agency. At the State level, the scheme is implemented through State offices of KVIC, State Khadi and Village Industries Boards (KVIBs), District Industries Centre's (DICs), Coir Board (for coir-related activities), and Banks. The government may also involve other suitable agencies for the implementation of the scheme.

faqs.question: What Is Maximum Project Cost Allowed Under PMEGP?
faqs.answer: Rs.25.00 lakhs for the manufacturing unit and Rs.10.00 lakhs for Service Unit

faqs.question: What Is The Component Of Project Cost?
faqs.answer: Capital Expenditure Loan, one cycle of working capital and 10% of project cost as own contribution in case of General category and 5% of project cost in case of weaker section.

faqs.question: Which Are The Financial Agencies?
faqs.answer: 27 Public Sector Banks, Regional Rural Banks(RRB), Co-operative Banks, and Private Scheduled Commercial Banks approved by respective State Task Force Committee.

faqs.question: How The Capital Expenditure Loan / Cash Credit Limit Be Utilized ?
faqs.answer: Working Capital at least once should touch the 100% limit of Cash Credit within three years of the Lock-in period of M.M. and not less than 75% of the utilization of the sanctioned limit on average.

faqs.question: Where The Beneficiary Has To Submit His/Her Application/ Project?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary can submit his/her application/Project online on kvic website www.kvic.org.in / kviconline.gov.in/pmegpeportal. A list of office addresses of KVIC/KVIB/DIC is available at our website.

faqs.question: What Is Village Industry ?
faqs.answer: Any Village Industry (except those mentioned in the negative list) located in the Rural Area which produces any goods or renders any service with or without the use of power and in which the fixed capital investment for head of a full time artisans or worker does not exceed Rs.1.00 lakh in plain area and Rs.1.50 lakhs in hilly areas and for A & N Island and Laxdeep Rs.4.5 Lakhs.

faqs.question: What Is Rural Area ?
faqs.answer: Any area classified as Village as per the revenue record of the State, irrespective of the population. It also includes an area even if classified as town provided its population does not exceed 20000.

faqs.question: What Is Age Limit ?
faqs.answer: Any adult beneficiary above 18 years is eligible for financing under PMEGP.

faqs.question: What Are The Main Criteria Of Project?
faqs.answer: It should fulfill the criteria of rural area (for Rural Area project), per capita investment, own contribution, negative list, and the unit should be a new one

faqs.question: Whether EDP Training Is Compulsory?
faqs.answer: Before MM Claim through the PMEGP portal, EDP training of 10 working days for a Project cost of More than 5.00 lakhs and 6 Working days of training for up to Project Cost of 5.00 lakhs to the beneficiary is compulsory

faqs.question: Whether Collateral Security Is Mandatory?
faqs.answer: As per RBI guidelines, the project costing up to Rs.10.00 lakhs under PMEGP loans are free from collateral security. The CGTSME provided a collateral guarantee for the project beyond Rs.5.00 lakhs and up to Rs.25.00 lakhs under the PMEGP scheme.

faqs.question: What Is PMEGP Scheme, And What Are Its Objectives?
faqs.answer: Answer: PMEGP stands for Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme, which is a credit-linked subsidy scheme launched by the Ministry of MSME, Government of India, to generate employment opportunities in the country. The main objective of the scheme is to create self-employment opportunities for unemployed youth and women entrepreneurs in rural and urban areas.

faqs.question: Who Is Eligible To Apply For PMEGP Scheme, And What Is The Age Limit For The Applicants?
faqs.answer: Answer: Any individual above 18 years of age can apply for the PMEGP scheme. However, the maximum age limit for applying is 35 years for general category applicants and 40 years for SC/ST/OBC/PH/Women candidates.

faqs.question: How Can I Apply For The PMEGP Scheme, And What Is The Application Procedure?
faqs.answer: Answer: You can apply for the PMEGP scheme through the online portal of KVIC, or offline by submitting the application form to the nearest KVIC office or bank. The application procedure involves filling up the application form, attaching the necessary documents, and submitting it along with the project report.

faqs.question: What Are The Different Types Of Projects That Can Be Set Up Under The PMEGP Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: The PMEGP scheme supports various types of projects, including manufacturing, service, and business projects. The projects should be viable and have the potential to generate employment opportunities.

faqs.question: How Much Financial Assistance Can I Expect To Receive Under The PMEGP Scheme, And What Is The Repayment Period?
faqs.answer: Answer: Under the PMEGP scheme, financial assistance is provided in the form of a subsidy, which ranges from 15% to 35% of the project cost, depending on the category of the applicant. The remaining amount can be obtained as a bank loan. The repayment period for the loan is generally 3 to 7 years.

faqs.question: Can I Apply For Multiple Projects Under The PMEGP Scheme, And What Is The Maximum Limit?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, an individual can apply for only one project under the PMEGP scheme. However, a group of individuals can apply for a group project, subject to a maximum of 10 members.

faqs.question: What Are The Documents Required To Apply For The PMEGP Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: The documents required for PMEGP scheme application include a project report, proof of identity and address, caste certificate (if applicable), educational qualification certificate, and bank account details.

faqs.question: How Long Does It Take For The PMEGP Scheme Application To Be Processed?
faqs.answer: Answer: The processing time for the PMEGP scheme application varies from state to state and depends on various factors such as the completeness of the application, the availability of funds, and the number of applications received.

faqs.question: Can I Apply For The PMEGP Scheme For An Existing Business?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, the PMEGP scheme is meant for setting up a new business or for expanding an existing business. An existing business is not eligible for financial assistance under the PMEGP scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Role Of The Khadi And Village Industries Commission (KVIC) In The PMEGP Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: KVIC is the nodal agency for implementing the PMEGP scheme. It is responsible for receiving and processing the applications, conducting training programs, and disbursing the subsidy to the beneficiaries through the banks.

faqs.question: What Is The Project Report, And How Do I Prepare It?
faqs.answer: Answer: The project report is a detailed document that provides information about the proposed project, its feasibility, and financial viability. It includes details like project cost, sources of funding, marketing plan, and expected income and expenses. KVIC provides a format for preparing the project report, which can be downloaded from their website.

faqs.question: Can I Apply For The PMEGP Scheme Offline?
faqs.answer: Answer: Yes, you can apply for the PMEGP scheme offline by submitting the application form along with the project report and necessary documents to the nearest KVIC office or bank.

faqs.question: Can I Apply For The PMEGP Scheme Online?
faqs.answer: Answer: Yes, you can apply for the PMEGP scheme online through the KVIC portal. The process involves registering on the portal, filling up the application form, and uploading the necessary documents.

faqs.question: What Are The Documents Required For The PMEGP Scheme Application?
faqs.answer: Answer: The documents required for the PMEGP scheme application include proof of identity and address, educational qualification certificate, caste certificate (if applicable), project report, and bank account details.

faqs.question: Can I Make Changes To My PMEGP Scheme Application After Submission?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, you cannot make changes to your PMEGP scheme application after submission. Therefore, it is important to ensure that all the information provided in the application is accurate and complete before submitting it.

faqs.question: How Long Does It Take For The PMEGP Scheme Application To Be Processed?
faqs.answer: Answer: The processing time for the PMEGP scheme application varies from state to state and depends on various factors such as the completeness of the application, the availability of funds, and the number of applications received.

faqs.question: How Will I Know If My PMEGP Scheme Application Has Been Approved?
faqs.answer: Answer: Once your PMEGP scheme application is approved, you will receive an approval letter from KVIC or the bank, along with the sanction letter stating the amount of subsidy and loan that you are eligible for.

name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
description: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) is an insurance scheme offering life insurance cover for death due to any reason. It is a one-year cover, renewable from year to year. The scheme is offered by banks/post offices and administered through life insurance companies. All individuals who are account holders of participating banks/ post office in the age group of 18 to 50 years are entitled to join.
benefits: PMJJBY offers one- year term life cover of ₹ 2.00 Lakh to all the subscribers in the age group of 18-50 years.It covers death due to any reason.Premium payable is ₹ 436/- per annum per subscriber
to be auto debited from the subscriber’s bank/post office account.
eligibility_criteria: The age of the applicant must be between 18 to 50 Years.The applicant must hold an individual bank / post office account.

faqs.question: How do I pay the premium for PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: The premium will be deducted from the account holder’s bank / Post office account through ‘auto debit’ facility.

faqs.question: What is the validity of the insurance cover in PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: Coverage under PMJJBY is valid for one year from 1st June to 31st May on payment of annual premium.

faqs.question: Is delayed enrolment for prospective cover  possible under this scheme?
faqs.answer:
Yes. 
Delayed enrolment for prospective cover is possible on payment of premium as described below – 
a)	For enrolment in June, July and August – Full Annual Premium of Rs.436/- is payable.
b)  	For enrolment in September, October, and November –premium of Rs. 342/- is payable
c)	    For enrolment in December, January and February –premium of Rs. 228/- is payable.
d)	For enrolment in March, April and May –premium of    Rs. 114/- is payable.

faqs.question: If I decide to exit the scheme, is there any possibility that I can rejoin at a later point of time?
faqs.answer:
Yes.
One can enroll again under the same conditions of eligibility stipulated in the Scheme.

faqs.question: Who will offer / administer the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme would be offered / administered through Insurance   companies willing to offer the product with necessary approvals on similar terms, in collaboration with participating Banks. Participating banks will be free to engage any such insurance company for implementing the scheme for their subscribers.

faqs.question: What is the minimum eligibility to subscribe to PMJJBY?
faqs.answer:
All savings bank account holders in the age 18 to 50 years in participating banks will be entitled to join. 
In case of multiple bank accounts held by an individual in one or different banks, the person would be eligible to join the scheme through one saving bank account only.

faqs.question: Who would be the Master policy holder for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Participating Banks/ Post Offices will be the Master policy holders.

faqs.question: Are NRIs eligible for coverage under PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: Any NRI having an eligible bank account with a bank branch located in India is eligible for purchase of PMJJBY cover subject to fulfilment of the terms and conditions relating to the scheme. However, in case a claim arises, the claim benefit will be paid to the beneficiary/ nominee only in Indian currency.

faqs.question: Does the PMJJBY cover death resulting from natural calamities such as earthquake, flood and other convulsions of nature? What about coverage from suicide / murder?
faqs.answer: Yes, all these events are covered under PMJJBY.

faqs.question: What are the changes in the terms of insurance coverage applicable to new subscribers?
faqs.answer: For subscribers enrolling for the first time on or after 1st June 2016, insurance benefit shall not be available for death (due to any cause other than accident) occurring during the first 30 days from the date of enrolment into the scheme. Death due to accidental causes will be covered from day one of insurance coverage.

faqs.question: How do I access the Claim Form for PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: The claim forms can be accessed from the link - https://www.jansuraksha.gov.in/Files/PMJJBY/English/ClaimForm.pdf

name: Chief Minister's State Disability Pension Scheme - Sikkim

This scheme is 100% State Innovative Scheme and the beneficiary will receive a monthly pension of ₹ 1500/-.
benefits: The beneficiary will receive a monthly pension of ₹ 1500/-.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of the state of Sikkim.The applicant with 40% and above disability is eligible for the scheme.The applicant should belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) household.The applicant should not be covered under Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS).The applicant should have opened the Bank Account under “Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana”.

faqs.question: What should be the monthly pension under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary will receive a sum of ₹1500/- as a monthly pension under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is the scheme is 100% State Innovative Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is 100% State Innovative Scheme.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: A person with 40% and above disability is eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the age limit under this scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no age restriction for applying under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of the state of Sikkim?
faqs.answer: Yes, only a resident of Sikkim state is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable only for Below Poverty Line (BPL) category?
faqs.answer: Yes, a person of BPL family of Sikkim state with a disability of 40% & above is eligible under the scheme.

faqs.question: Should a person covered under Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS) is also eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, a person covered under Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme (IGNDPS) is not eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to have a certificate of disability while applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant must have a certificate of disability duly certified by the Medical Authorities.

faqs.question: How can I register under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant may register/apply through the online portal link: https://pensionscheme.sikkim.gov.in

faqs.question: How will the pension distributed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The pension shall be distributed through Direct Benefit Transfer System.

name: Jeevanam Self-Employment Scheme To Dependents Of Crime Victims
description: The scheme “Jeevanam Self-Employment Scheme to Dependents of Crime Victims” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. As part of strengthening the victim support services in the State, the Government of Kerala has started this scheme which provides financial aid to dependents as well as victims of crime. The assistance would benefit those who were struggling to make a living, including dependents of the victims of the crime and those with serious injuries. When a crime is committed it can have significant, yet varying consequences, on the individual who became the victim of the crime and his family. The devastating impact of crime results in emotional, psychological, and physical as well as financial consequences. If the head of the family is killed or injured in a crime, the family is left without the main breadwinner. Killing or seriously injuring the earning member of the household as a result of the crime will deprive a family of their livelihood.
benefits: Under the scheme
financial assistance of ₹20
000/- will be provided as one-time assistance to the eligible beneficiary.Note: The amount will be transferred to the respective applicant’s bank account.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State.The applicant must be either the person who has been seriously injured in a crime or must be a dependent - Wife/Husband/Unmarried son or daughter of the victim of the crime.The annual income of the family should not exceed ₹1

000/-.The applicant should have applied within 5 years of the crime.Note: The beneficiary selected for the grant–in–aid is required to execute an agreement with the Department of social justice on a stamp paper of ₹200/- to meet the above criteria.
required_documents: Copy of Aadhaar cardMobile numberEmail idPassport Size PhotoCopy of Ration Card (Submit the page containing the name of the ration card holder and the page containing the family members together) Project proposal of the proposed work/business Income CertificateCopy of FIRCopy of Bank Passbook- Bank account detailsOther documents
if any

faqs.question: What is the “Jeevanam Self-Employment Scheme to Dependents of Crime Victims” scheme?
faqs.answer: The Government of Kerala has started this scheme which provides financial aid to dependents as well as victims of crime. The assistance would benefit those who were struggling to make a living, including dependents of the victims of the crime and those with serious injuries.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be either the person who has been seriously injured in a crime or must be a dependent - Wife/Husband/Unmarried son or daughter of the victim of the crime.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the dependents of Crime Victims?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for the dependents of Crime Victims.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the family should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: How many times a beneficiary can avail of the benefit under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Only once a beneficiary can avail of the benefit under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹20,000/- will be provided as one-time assistance to the eligible beneficiary.

faqs.question: Is the beneficiary selected for the grant–in–aid required to execute an agreement with the department?
faqs.answer: Yes, the beneficiary selected for the grant–in–aid is required to execute an agreement with the Department of social justice on a stamp paper of ₹200/- to meet the above criteria.

faqs.question: Within how many days the applicant should apply for financial assistance?
faqs.answer: The applicant should have applied within 5 years of the crime.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal- SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.  https://suneethi.sjd.kerala.gov.in

It focuses on enhancing welfare initiatives, improving living standards, and providing opportunities for development in various sectors for the SC category.
benefits: The scheme offers a 100% grant based on government approval for project proposals from line departments
recommended by the evaluation committee.

faqs.question: What is the Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jaati Vishesh Pariyojana Vitt Poshan Yojana?
faqs.answer: This scheme provides financial assistance for special project proposals benefiting the Scheduled Caste (SC) category in Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants from the Scheduled Caste category who submit project proposals in accordance with the norms of the respective line departments.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants need to submit their project proposals through the relevant line departments, ensuring that all required criteria are met.

faqs.question: What type of projects are eligible under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Projects that benefit the Scheduled Caste category, in line with the objectives of the scheme, are eligible for funding.

faqs.question: How is the grant provided under the scheme?

faqs.question: Who approves the project proposals?

faqs.question: What are the steps involved in applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The steps include submitting a project proposal to the relevant line department, which will then be reviewed and recommended for government approval.

name: Financial Assistance to Non Governmental Organisations
description: The Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu launched the scheme "Financial Assistance to Non Governmental Organisations". Under this scheme, funds are sanctioned to schools for children with an intellectual disability run by NGOs towards feeding charges, rent, and construction/extension of buildings.﻿
benefits: Financial assistance is given to the NGO for feeding charges
rent
and construction/extension of building.
eligibility_criteria: The school for children with intellectual disability should have functioned for a minimum period of 5 years.  The school should be registered under section 51 of the Rights of Persons with Disability Act
required_documents: Registration Certificate (under Section 51 of the Rights of Persons with Disability Act
2016). Any Other Document If Required.

faqs.question: What expenses are covered by the financial assistance provided to NGOs?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance provided to NGOs covers feeding charges, rent, and construction/extension of building for schools catering to children with intellectual disabilities.

faqs.question: How long should a school for children with intellectual disabilities have been operational to be eligible for funding?
faqs.answer: Schools for children with intellectual disabilities must have been operational for a minimum period of 5 years to be eligible for funding.

faqs.question: Are there any specific guidelines or regulations governing the use of funds by NGOs?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are specific guidelines and regulations governing the use of funds by NGOs, which should be adhered to.

faqs.question: Can NGOs use the funds for salaries of staff members?
faqs.answer: No, funds can be utilized for approved purposes such as feeding charges, rent, and construction/extension of building, but not for salaries of staff members.

faqs.question: Can NGOs apply for financial assistance if they are not registered under Section 51 of the Rights of Persons with Disability Act, 2016?
faqs.answer: No, NGOs need to be registered under Section 51 of the Rights of Persons with Disability Act, 2016, to be eligible for financial assistance.

faqs.question: Is there a specific timeframe for submitting applications?
faqs.answer: While there may not be a strict timeframe, applications should be submitted within a reasonable period.

faqs.question: Who is the contact person for addressing grievances?
faqs.answer: Grievances related to the scheme can be addressed to the Deputy Director (Schemes) at the Commissionerate for Welfare of the Differently abled.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the amount of funding that can be requested?
faqs.answer: While there not be a specified limit on the amount of funding, it depends on the discretion of the authorities and the availability of funds.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for receiving the application?
faqs.answer: The application is to be submitted to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Are there any reporting requirements for NGOs receiving financial assistance?
faqs.answer: NGOs receiving financial assistance may have reporting requirements to provide updates on fund utilization and program outcomes.

name: Pre Matric Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
description: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) studying in class 9th and class 10th in a government school or a school recognized by the government or CBSE or State Board.﻿The students with the specified disabilities defined in Schedule of the "Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016" will be eligible under this scheme. This includes persons with visual, hearing, speech, loco-motor, mental retardation, and other disabilities. NOS is implemented offline by the DEPwD.﻿At times SwDs are deprived of harnessing their latent skills and thereby miss the opportunity. This scheme aims to support SwDs to study further in order to prepare themselves to earn their livelihood and to find a dignified place for themselves in the society as they face several barriers physical, financial, psychological, mental in pursuing studies and living with dignity.
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
benefits: Maintenance Allowance * (₹ per Month): Day Scholars: 500

Hostellers: 800.Book Grant: ₹ 1000/- per annum.Disability Allowances (₹ per Annum):Visually Impaired: 4000.Hearing Impaired: 2000.Physically Disabled (OH): 2000.Intellectual Disabilities: 4000.All other types of disability not covered above: 2000.﻿[NOTE: (*) means for 12 months in an academic year]
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a student studying in Class 9th or Class 10th.The applicant must be disabled

with disability percentage of 40% or above.The Total Annual income of parents/guardians of the applicant (from all sources) must not exceed ₹ 2.00 Lakh per Annum.The applicant must not be availing any other scholarship by the govt.The applicant must not be the third sibling of the family who has been given this scholarship.
required_documents: Photograph.Proof of Age.Certificate of Disability (issued by the competent authority)Income Certificate.Tuition Fee Receipt.Last academic qualification certificate.Bank Details of the applicant or of the Parent/Guardian.﻿The institution in which the candidate is studying should also register itself at NSP and verify the details provided by the candidates.

faqs.question: Am I eligible for this scholarship if two of my siblings are availing the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No. You won’t be eligible in this case.

faqs.question: By when shall the scholarship become payable?
faqs.answer: The scholarship will become payable after the student has secured admission and has started attending the classes.

faqs.question: Is there a validity to the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: The benefits are provided till the complete duration of the course.

faqs.question: What would be the mode of payment of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The payment of the scholarship will be through DBT.

faqs.question: What if there are more than one student with equal marks for the last available slot?
faqs.answer: In such cases, the percentage of disability will be considered. The candidate with higher percentage of disability will get preference. In case there is still a tie, the age will be considered and the older candidate will get preference.

faqs.question: Will I be eligible for the scholarship if I fail to get promoted to the next semester?
faqs.answer: No. The scholarship will be terminated in that case.

faqs.question: Is there a percentage of slots reserved for girl students?
faqs.answer: Yes, 50% of the total slots are reserved for girl students.

faqs.question: Can I apply offline for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: No. You need to visit https://scholarships.gov.in/ to apply.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: Do I need to complete the application in one sitting?
faqs.answer: No. You can save the application as draft and continue at a later time before the deadline.

faqs.question: How do I track the status of my application?
faqs.answer: You can check the same anytime by visiting the Applicant Dashboard and clicking “Track Status” in the left pane.

faqs.question: What should be the type and size of the documents to be uploaded?
faqs.answer: The format should be.pdf or .jpeg. The size of each document should not be greater than 200 kb.

faqs.question: In what cases a Bonafide Certificate from the institute is needed?
faqs.answer: It is needed if the institute is located in a State/UT different from domicile State/UT of the applicant.

faqs.question: How do I know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields have a red asterisk (*) mark at the end.

name: Sanctioning of Daisy Players to Visually Challenged

000/- per month – half of the cost covered.Category III: Parent/Guardian income above ₹20
000/- per month – full cost to be borne by the beneficiary.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Daisy Player sanction scheme?

faqs.question: Is the Daisy Player provided under this scheme a one-time benefit?

faqs.question: What should I do if I find incorrect information in my application after submission?
faqs.answer: Report the error immediately to the concerned authorities. Providing false information can result in legal action and the requirement to return the Daisy Player or its cost.

faqs.question: How will the Daisy Players be distributed to the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Daisy Players will be distributed through the Assistant Directors or District Managers of the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled & Senior Citizens.

faqs.question: How is the scheme monitored to prevent double or false claims?
faqs.answer: Detailed records of beneficiaries are maintained by the Assistant Directors and District Managers to ensure transparency and avoid duplicate claims.

faqs.question: Can I apply for a Daisy Player if I am studying a non-professional course?

faqs.question: What is the cost of the Daisy Player provided under this scheme?

faqs.question: Can I choose the Daisy Player model or brand under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the Daisy Players are procured and distributed as per the scheme’s guidelines.

faqs.question: How long does the application process take?
faqs.answer: The duration may vary; it is advisable to contact the respective office for specific timelines.

faqs.question: Who can I contact for more information about the Daisy Player sanction scheme?
faqs.answer: You can contact the Assistant Directors or District Managers of the A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation for more details.

Phd
Law
Management

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for applying for the free laptop scheme?

faqs.question: Are there any specific brands or models of laptops provided?

faqs.question: Can students choose the specifications of the laptop they receive?

faqs.question: Is there any support provided for maintenance or repairs of the laptops?

name: Fee Waiver Scheme For SC/ST Students Pursuing Higher Education

This Scheme is framed in order to provide free access to every SC/ST student, to the institutions of higher learning. It shall be the endeavour of the Government to see that no eligible SC/ST students are deprived of higher education for want of resources. The Scheme is operated by Directorate of Higher Education for the students pursuing the courses of General Education and by Directorate of Technical Education for students pursuing Technical Education at the degree and post graduate level.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?

faqs.answer: Children of construction workers registered under the Meghalaya Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board are eligible for the scholarship.

faqs.answer: The scholarship includes stipends ranging from ₹400 to ₹800 per month depending on the level of study, along with one-time book and uniform grants.

faqs.question: Can a scholar reapply for this fellowship if they don't complete their research work during the fellowship period?
faqs.answer: No, a scholar who doesn't complete their research work during the fellowship period is not eligible to apply again under this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any provisions for House Rent Allowance (HRA), and how is it determined?
faqs.answer: HRA is provided to students not provided with hostel accommodation. The rates are 8%, 16%, and 24% as applicable in the city/location where the research fellows are working, in accordance with Govt. of India norms.

faqs.question: Is there any assistance provided for Physically and Visually Handicapped Candidates?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is assistance of Rs. 2,000/- per month for both JRF and SRF candidates in the form of Escort/Reader Assistance.

faqs.question: What are the contingency rates for Humanities & Social Sciences and Sciences streams for JRF and SRF?
faqs.answer: For JRF, it's Rs. 10,000/- per year for initial two years in Humanities & Social Sciences and Rs. 12,000/- per year for Sciences. For SRF, it's Rs. 20,500/- per year for Humanities & Social Sciences and Rs. 25,000/- per year for Sciences.

faqs.question: What are the rates of fellowship for JRF and SRF candidates in different streams?
faqs.answer: For JRF candidates, the rate is Rs. 31,000/- per month for initial two years, and for SRF, it's Rs. 35,000/- per month for the remaining tenure.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the fellowship for M.Phil., Ph.D., and combined M.Phil. + Ph.D. courses?
faqs.answer: The maximum duration for M.Phil is 2 years, for Ph.D. it is 5 years, and for M.Phil + Ph.D., it is also 5 years.

faqs.question: Are there any provisions for Persons with Disabilities (PwD) within the Scheduled Caste category?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a provision for reservation for PwD who belong to the SC category as per the 'Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016.' A minimum disability of 40% is required for eligibility.

faqs.question: Can individuals who are already employed in educational institutions avail this fellowship?
faqs.answer: No, employees of any educational institution, including universities and government employees, cannot avail this fellowship.

faqs.question: How is the fellowship disbursed in terms of timing and mode?
faqs.answer: The fellowship is disbursed from the date of the JRF award letter or the date of joining M.Phil./Ph.D., whichever is later. It is granted up to the date of Ph.D. thesis submission or a maximum of five years. The mode of disbursal is through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to Aadhaar-linked bank accounts.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the number of fellowships awarded each year?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides 2000 new Fellowships annually, including 1500 Junior Research Fellowships for Humanities/Social Sciences and 500 Junior Research Fellowships for Science streams.

faqs.question: Which department oversees this fellowship scheme, and when was it introduced?
faqs.answer: The Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, under the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, introduced this scheme during the financial year 2005-06.

description: Coaching schemes for students belonging to SC (Scheduled Caste), ST (Scheduled Tribe), OBC (Other Backward Classes) (non-creamy layer), and minority communities are implemented to provide them with equal opportunities and support in pursuing higher education. These schemes aim to bridge the educational gap and enhance the competitiveness of these students. The Commission has been providing separate assistance to the universities For remedial coaching at UG and PG levels.Coaching for entry into services.Coaching for NET to Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and Minority Candidates. The Commission has decided to merge this scheme with the General Developmental Assistance scheme of the universities and assistance for this component will be over and above the ceiling of General Developmental Assistance. ﻿Objective Of The SchemeI. REMEDIAL COACHING FOR SC/ST/OBC (NON-CREAMY LAYER) & MINORITY COMMUNITY STUDENTS Remedial Coaching is to be organized at the Undergraduate and /or Postgraduate level with objectives to: Improve the academic skills and linguistic proficiency of the students in various subjects. To raise their level of comprehension of basic subjects to provide a stronger foundation for further academic work. To strengthen their knowledge, skills, and attitudes in such subjects, where quantitative and qualitative techniques and laboratory activities are involved, so that, the necessary guidance and training provided under the program may enable the students to come up to the level necessary for pursuing higher studies efficiently and to reduce their failure and dropout rate. To provide career guidance and psychological counseling for capacity building to those who are in need of such counseling. ﻿II. COACHING CLASSES FOR ENTRY INTO SERVICES FOR SC/ST/OBC (NON-CREAMY LAYER) AND MINORITY COMMUNITY STUDENTS Coaching scheme for entry into services is to be organized with objectives to: Prepare students to gain useful employment in Group A’, ‘B’ and ‘C’ in Central services, State services, and equivalent positions in the private sector. To orient students for particular examinations conducted for selection to services such as IAS, State Public Services, Bank recruitment, etc.To focus on the specific requirements of a particular competitive examination. faqs.question: Who is eligible for coaching schemes for SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer) and minority students?

faqs.question: What benefits do coaching schemes provide?
faqs.answer: Coaching schemes offer benefits such as specialized training, expert faculty, study materials, mentorship, financial assistance, exposure to competitive exam patterns, and access to quality coaching. These benefits aim to enhance academic performance, competitiveness, confidence, and overall personal and professional development.

faqs.question: How can I apply for coaching schemes for SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer) and minority students?

Generally, you need to research the available schemes, review eligibility criteria, gather required documents, obtain the application form, fill it out accurately, attach supporting documents, and submit the application within the designated timeframe. faqs.question: Are there any financial assistance or scholarships available for coaching?
faqs.answer: Many coaching schemes provide financial assistance, scholarships, or subsidized coaching fees to support students from economically disadvantaged backgrounds. These financial benefits aim to reduce the financial burden on students and make coaching more accessible.

faqs.question: How can I track the status of my application?
faqs.answer: After submitting your application, you may receive a reference number or acknowledgment. Use this information to track the status of your application. Stay informed about any communication from the concerned authorities regarding your application, such as notifications about shortlisting, interviews, or further steps in the selection process.

faqs.question: Are coaching schemes only available for competitive exams or also for university admissions?

faqs.question: Where can I find more information about coaching schemes for SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer) and minority students?

Additionally, you can reach out to counseling centers, coaching centers, or student welfare offices for guidance and further information.

name: Kanya Dhan Scheme for SC Students
description: The scheme "Kanya Dhan Scheme for SC Students" by the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, an amount of ₹ 25,000/- is provided to the girl students of the Scheduled Caste Communities once they pass the 12th standard board examination (or its equivalent examination). The applications for this scheme are accepted online. The scheme is being implemented by Chief Minister Scholarship Portal, Government of Goa.
benefits: An amount of ₹ 25

000/- is provided as a fixed deposit in the name of the girl child and the officer nominated by the government.NOTE: The amount is disbursed to the beneficiaries after they pass the 12th standard board (or equivalent) examination.
eligibility_criteria: For ApplicationThe applicant should be a girl.The applicant should be a student.The applicant should have passed the 10th Standard of examination.The applicant should have appeared in the 11th Standard of any stream (Science/Arts/Commerce/Vocational/ITI).Upto 2 girl children of a family are entitled under this scheme.﻿For Disbursal of BenefitsThe applicant should have passed the 12th standard examination in three attempts or within two years of the first attempt
whichever is earlier (otherwise
the money shall be forfeited and credited to the Government Treasury).
required_documents: Aadhaar CardCaste CertificateIncome CertificatePassport Size PhotoRation Card

faqs.question: What happens if a student takes more than three attempts to clear the 12th standard examination, and how is the forfeiture of the deposit handled?
faqs.answer: If a student exceeds three attempts or takes more than two years from the first attempt, the deposited amount of ₹25,000 is automatically forfeited and credited to the Government Treasury. There is no provision for appeal in such cases.

faqs.question: As a divorced mother with three SC daughters, can all my daughters apply for this scheme, or is there a family-wise restriction?
faqs.answer: The scheme explicitly limits benefits to up to 2 girl children per family. Even if all three daughters meet other eligibility criteria, only two can receive the benefit, and you would need to choose which two will apply.

faqs.question: If a student changes her stream between 11th and 12th standard (example: from Science to Commerce), does it affect her eligibility for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, changing streams does not affect eligibility. The scheme allows students from any stream (Science/Arts/Commerce/Vocational/ITI) as long as they pass 12th standard within the stipulated timeframe.

faqs.question: If the applicant's caste certificate is under process, can she submit the application with the acknowledgment receipt and provide the certificate later?
faqs.answer: The portal requires mandatory upload of a valid caste certificate during application. Acknowledgment receipts or provisional documents are not accepted, so students should ensure they have a valid certificate before starting the application.

faqs.question: How is the fixed deposit of ₹25,000 structured - can the student access it immediately after passing 12th standard?
faqs.answer: The amount is provided as a fixed deposit in joint names of the girl child and a government-nominated officer. The specific terms of deposit access and maturity are determined by the government officer assigned to the case.

faqs.question: If a student's application is rejected by the school during verification, what is the process for appeal or resubmission?
faqs.answer: If rejected, the school can return the application to the student for corrections. The student can then make necessary changes and resubmit. Multiple resubmissions are allowed as long as it's within the application deadline.

faqs.question: What happens if there are discrepancies between the Aadhaar card details and school records? How should such cases be handled?
faqs.answer: Students should ensure all documents match before applying. In case of discrepancies, they should get their school records updated to match their Aadhaar details first, as the portal uses Aadhaar as the primary identification document.

faqs.question: Can a student who completed her 10th standard from another state but is now studying 11th in Goa apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme focuses on current education status rather than previous schooling. As long as the student meets category criteria and has valid Goa documentation, she can apply.
