faqs.question: Can I Apply Offline For The Scholarship?
faqs.answer: No. You need to visit https://scholarships.gov.in/ to apply.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: Do I Need To Complete The Application In One Sitting?
faqs.answer: No. You can save the application as draft and continue at a later time before the deadline.

faqs.question: How Do I Track The Status Of My Application?
faqs.answer: You can check the same anytime by visiting the Applicant Dashboard and clicking “Track Status” in the left pane.

faqs.question: What Should Be The Type And Size Of The Documents To Be Uploaded?
faqs.answer: The format should be.pdf or .jpeg. The size of each document should not be greater than 200 kb.

faqs.question: How Do I Know If A Field In The Application Form Is Mandatory?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields have a red asterisk (*) mark at the end.

name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
description: An employment scheme by the Ministry of Rural Development, providing provide at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year to every rural household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled work. Any Indian citizen above the age of 18 years and residing in a rural area can apply to this scheme. The applicant receives guaranteed employment within 15 days from the date of application.﻿The wage is deposited directly in the Bank Account / Post Office Account of the applicant. Wages are paid within a week, or fifteen days at most. Men and Women are paid equally. MGNREGA covers the entire country with the exception of districts that have a hundred percent urban population.
benefits: The applicant receives guaranteed employment within 15 days from the date of application.Work is to be provided within a radius of 5 kilometers of the applicant’s residence if possible
and in any case within the Block. If the applicant lives more than 5 km away from the worksite
he/she will be entitled to a travel and subsistence allowance (10% of the minimum wage).Wages are paid within a week
or fifteen days at most. Men and Women are paid equally.Shade
drinking water

and first-aid are provided at every worksite.﻿Exclusive measures for the promotion of the participation of the disabled persons:Identification of suitable worksMobilization of disabled persons by focussing on awareness and special provisionsSpecifically identified works for disabled persons in the case of large GPsPreference to appoint as mates and as workers for providing drinking water
to manage crèches
etc.

at the worksitesAdoption of tools and equipment/facilities at workplacesTreating persons with disabilities with respectSpecial drive to ensure 100 days of employment to such householdsProvide a special job card of a distinct color﻿Specific attention and provisions for Senior Citizens: Exclusive senior citizen groups may be formed and special works which require lesser physical effort are identified and allotted to these groups.﻿Specific attention and provisions for Internally Displaced Persons:A special job card to be provided will be valid till these families are displaced and will lose its validity as soon as they return to their original place of residence.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be at least 18 years of age.The applicant must be residing in a Rural Area.
required_documents: Photograph of ApplicantName
Age
and Gender of all NREGA Job Card Applicants from the applicant’s householdName of Village
Gram Panchayat
BlockProof of Identity (Ration card
Voter ID Card
Aadhaar
PAN)Details of whether the applicant is a beneficiary of SC / ST / Indira Awaas Yojana (IAY) / Land Reform (LR)Specimen Signature / Thumb impression

faqs.question: Who Are The Key Stakeholders In MGNREGA?
faqs.answer:
The key stakeholders in MGNREGA are the following: 
Wage seekers, Gram Sabha (GS), Three-tier Panchayati Raj Institutions (PRIs), Programme Officer at the Block level, District Programme Coordinator (DPC), State Government, Ministry of Rural Development (MoRD), Civil Society, Other stakeholders [viz. line departments, convergence departments, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), etc.

faqs.question: Will The Wage Be Paid Monthly, Weekly Or On Daily Basis?
faqs.answer: The disbursement of daily wages shall be made on a weekly basis or in any case not later than a fortnight after the date on which such work was done.

faqs.question: What Is Wage Rate For Women Employed For Providing Child Care Services?
faqs.answer: The women so employed should be paid remuneration equivalent to the prevailing wage rate.

faqs.question: What Information Will Be Provided In The Wage Slip?
faqs.answer: Individual pay slips or wage slips should have the details of wage payments like work ID, wage rate, number of days worked, amount earned by the worker during the week, number of mandays completed per HH and number of mandays of employment due to the households concerned etc. The format of the Wage Slip can be found in Annexure-15 of the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: How Are The Payments Of Wages Made To The Wage Seekers?
faqs.answer: The payment of wages shall, unless so exempted by the Central Government, be made through the individual savings accounts of the workers in the relevant banks or post offices.

faqs.question: Is There Any Authentic Document Required To Open The Wage Seeker Account?
faqs.answer: MGNREGS Job Card, duly signed by the concerned officer is an officially valid document for opening a bank account under the Know Your Customer (KYC) norms.

faqs.question: Is there any compensation for delay in payment of wages?
faqs.answer: MGNREGA has laid down a detailed procedure for establishing a delay compensation system. As per the system, MGNREGA workers are entitled to receive delay compensation at a rate of 0.05 per cent of the unpaid wages per day for the duration of the delay beyond the sixteenth day of the closure of the MR.

faqs.question: What social security is provided for MGNREGS workers?
faqs.answer:
The two types of insurance provided under social security exclusively for MGNREGS workers are:
(i) Janashree Bima Yojana (JBY): JBY provides life coverage and disability benefits to rural people.
(ii) Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY): RSBY has been extended to all Mahatma Gandhi NREGA workers/ beneficiaries who have worked for more than 15 days in the preceding financial year.

faqs.question: Who Is Designated As PO In MGNREGS?
faqs.answer: At the block level Executive authorities such as Tehsildar/Block Development Officer are often designated as PO. For blocks that have high concentration of SC/STs/landless labourers and are likely to have more demand for MGNREGA works should have a committed / dedicated PO for MGNREGA. The PO should not be assigned responsibilities not directly related to MGNREGA.

faqs.question: What Is A Job Card?
faqs.answer:
Job Card is a key document that records workers’ entitlements under MGNREGA. It legally empowers
the registered households to apply for work, ensures transparency and protects workers against fraud.

faqs.question: Is There Any Pre-Printed Form For Providing Details While Registering For Job Card?
faqs.answer:
The State Government may make a printed form available as per format prescribed in the relevant
Annexures of the MGNREGA Operational Guidelines 2013. However, a printed form should not be insisted upon.

faqs.question: Can All Adult Members Of A Household Register For Job Card?
faqs.answer: Yes, all the adult members of a household willing to do unskilled manual work can register themselves to obtain a job card under MGNREGA.

faqs.question: For How Many Years Is The Registration For Job Card Valid?
faqs.answer:
The registration is valid for five years and may be renewed/re-validated following process prescribed
for renewal/revalidation as and when required.

faqs.question: When Is An Applicant Eligible For Unemployment Allowance?
faqs.answer:
If an applicant is not provided employment within fifteen days of receipt of his/her application seeking
employment, in all cases of advance application, employment should be provided from the date that
employment has been sought, or within 15 days of the date of application, whichever is later. Else, unemployment allowance becomes due. It will be calculated automatically by the computer system
or the Management Information System (MIS).

faqs.question: Who Constitutes Special Category Of Workers (Vulnerable Groups) Under MGNREGA?
faqs.answer:
The special category of workers are from:
i) Persons with disabilities
ii) Primitive Tribal Groups
iii) Nomadic Tribal Groups
iv) Denotified Tribes
v) Women in special circumstances
vi) Senior citizens above 65 years of age
vii) HIV positive persons
viii) Internally displaced persons
ix) Rehabilitated bonded labour

faqs.question: Are Any Special Works Identified For Differently Abled Persons Working Under MGNREGA? If So, Provide A Few Examples.
faqs.answer:
Yes, several works are exclusively identified for differently abled persons. Further, suggestive works
for category of differently abled persons are provided. A few of the works are: Drinking water arrangements, Sprinkling water on newly built wall, Farm bunding, Looking after children, Plantation.

faqs.question: Who Are Eligible To Become Members In Labour Groups?
faqs.answer: Workers who have put in 10 days of work during the previous year are eligible to apply to be a member of the labour groups.

faqs.question: What Is The Procedure To Register Oneself For Employment?
faqs.answer: Household having adult members desirous of seeking unskilled wage employment in MGNREGA may apply for registration. The application for registration may be given on prescribed form or plain paper to the local Gram Panchayat. To allow maximum opportunities to families that may migrate, registration shall also be opened throughout the year at the GP office.

faqs.question: If The Information Contained In The Application Found To Be Incorrect, What Is The Process To Be Adopted?
faqs.answer:
The Gram Panchayat will refer the application to PO. The PO, after independent verification of facts and giving the person concerned an opportunity to be heard, may direct the GP to either - 
(i). register the household or
(ii). reject the application or 
(iii). secure the particulars correct and re-process the application.

faqs.question: Should The Cost Towards Job Card (Including The Photograph Affixed On It) Be Borne By The Applicant?
faqs.answer: No, the cost of the Job Cards, including that of the photographs affixed on it, are covered under the administrative expenses and borne as a part of the programme cost.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision To Provide Duplicate Job Card For A Lost One?
faqs.answer:
Yes, a Job Cardholder may apply for a duplicate Job Card, if the original is lost or damaged. The application will be given to the GP and shall be processed in the manner of a new application, with
the difference being that the particulars may also be verified using the duplicate copy of the JC maintained by the Panchayat.

name: Jharkhand Patrakar Samman Pension Niyamawali
description: The "Jharkhand Patrakar Samman Pension Niyamawali" was launched by the Information and Public Relations Department, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to journalists who have served the state for an extended period. It ensures their well-being post-retirement and acknowledges their contribution to media and society.﻿Objective:To support retired full-time journalists by offering a monthly pension and recognizing their dedication and service in the field of journalism.﻿Scope:The scheme applies to journalists across Jharkhand and includes provisions for family pensions for their dependents after their demise.
benefits: A monthly pension of ₹7

500/- for journalists.The family pension of 50% of the journalist's pension goes to the spouse after their demise.Lifetime pension for retired journalists who meet the eligibility criteria.﻿NOTE: Pension payments are made directly to beneficiaries' bank accounts through an online transfer.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Jharkhand.The applicant should be a journalist.The applicant should have an employee as a full-time journalist/media professional for a minimum of 20 years in Jharkhand or undivided Bihar (pre-November 15

2000).The applicant should not be a pension beneficiary from any other media institution or government.The applicant should have retired at the age of 58 or as per the retirement norms of the media organization.The applicant should have an accreditation certificate issued by the Directorate of Information and Public Relations at the time of retirement.The applicant must not have any criminal convictions leading to imprisonment of more than two years.﻿
required_documents: Self-declaration Affidavit (20 years of full-time service as a journalist in Jharkhand).Service Duration Certificate (issued by the editor(s) of media organizations where the applicant worked).Complete Details of contributions to the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) for at least 20 years.Accreditation Certificate (issued by the Information and Public Relations Directorate).Proof of Retirement Age (58 years or organization-specific retirement letter).Aadhaar Card or PAN Card for identification.Bank Account Details with a nationalized bank.Annual Life Certificate to be submitted in March each year.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Full-time journalists/media professionals with at least 20 years of service in Jharkhand and meeting other conditions.

faqs.question: What is the monthly pension amount under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible journalists receive ₹7,500 per month.

faqs.question: Can the spouse of a deceased journalist claim benefits?
faqs.answer: Yes, the spouse is entitled to 50% of the pension amount as a family pension.

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable to part-time journalists?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for full-time journalists.

faqs.question: What happens if a journalist is convicted of a crime?
faqs.answer: Convictions leading to imprisonment of more than two years will disqualify the applicant from receiving the pension.

faqs.question: What documents are required for application?
faqs.answer: Documents include a service certificate, EPF details, accreditation certificate, and retirement proof, among others.

faqs.question: Where should the application form be submitted?
faqs.answer: Submit the form to the Directorate of Information and Public Relations, Jharkhand.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable to journalists from outside Jharkhand?
faqs.answer: No, only journalists who served in Jharkhand are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the minimum retirement age for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The retirement age is 58 years, or as per the norms of the journalist’s organization.

faqs.question: How is the pension amount disbursed?
faqs.answer: The pension is directly transferred to the beneficiary’s bank account.

faqs.question: Can a journalist apply for this scheme posthumously?
faqs.answer: No, only living journalists or their dependents can apply.

faqs.question: What happens if false information is provided?
faqs.answer: The pension will be revoked, and any financial benefits received fraudulently will be recovered.

name: Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojana
description: The scheme "Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojana" was launched by the Director of Information and Public Relations Department, Government of Himachal Pradesh under the Himachal Pradesh Journalists Welfare Fund Scheme, 2006. The purpose of the Yojana shall be to provide financial assistance to the serving accreditated journalists and retired accreditated journalists in adverse situations as accidents and illness etc.
benefits: Financial assistance to serving accredited journalist:-In case of permanent incapacitation for further service while performing field duties as a journalist₹ 1
000/-In case of death while performing field Duties₹ 2
000/-In case of death during attack or any untoward incidence of violence  ₹ 3
000/-In case of medical emergency or cancerUpto ₹ 50
000/- (as per emergent need for major disease as kidney transplant
heart disease etc.)﻿Financial assistance to retired accredited journalist:In case of death   ₹ 50
000/-In case of medical emergency or cancerUpto ₹ 50
000/- (as per emergent need for major disease as kidney transplant
heart disease etc.)﻿Assistance in Adverse Situations:Financial assistance of ₹25
000/- only as immediate serving accredited journalists and retired accredited journalists or their dependents/legal heirs on production of documentary proof regarding death certificate
illness or accident etc. and subsequently its ex-post-facto approval would be obtained from the Committee.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a legal heir (spouse
his/her dependent

children) of the deceased journalist. The deceased serving/retired accredited journalist is unmarried or single the financial assistance will be released in favour of his or her dependent father or mother.The medical emergency or any other adverse situation assistance will be released to the serving/retired accredited journalists. The serving/retired accredited journalist's family annual income is less than ₹1

000/-. The retired journalist should serve of at least twenty years as accredited journalist with the Government of Himachal Pradesh and not taken other gainful employment besides journalism.The retired accredited journalist's age should be 58 years. NOTE: Himachal Pradesh Journalists Welfare Fund Scheme will be replaced by new H.P. Patrakar Kalyan Yojana
2017 hence who are already subscribers of Himachal Pradesh Journalists Welfare Fund Scheme
2006 will now be considered as member under this new Scheme.﻿
required_documents: Proof of Certificate (Aadhaar card/Voter ID card/PAN card/Ration card).Income certificate (issue Tehsildar (Class-I)/Sub Divisional Magistrate of the area).Death Certificate.Medical Certificate.

faqs.question: When did the scheme come into effect?
faqs.answer: It came into force upon its publication in the Rajptra of Himachal Pradesh or e-Gazette.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of this scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide financial assistance to serving and retired accredited journalists in adverse situations.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Serving and retired accredited journalists of Himachal Pradesh, meeting specific criteria.

faqs.question: Who administers the Himachal Pradesh Patrakar Kalyan Yojna?
faqs.answer: The scheme is administered by a Committee formed under the Government of Himachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: What is the composition of the Committee administering the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Committee includes the Minister-in-Charge (Chairman), Administrative Secretary, Finance Secretary, and Director of Information and Public Relations (Member Secretary).

faqs.question: How much immediate financial assistance can be provided in emergencies?
faqs.answer: Immediate assistance of ₹25,000 can be provided by the Director (I&PR).

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for financial assistance?
faqs.answer: Submit the application form directly to the Director (I&PR) or through the District Public Relations Officer.

faqs.question: How is the Patrakar Kalyan Fund audited?
faqs.answer: The accounts are audited by the Local Auditor, as managed by the Director (I&PR).

faqs.question: Can the scheme be amended?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Government of Himachal Pradesh can amend the scheme based on the Committee’s recommendations.

faqs.question: How often is the financial assistance reviewed and approved?
faqs.answer: The Committee reviews and approves financial assistance on a case-by-case basis, as per the scheme’s guidelines.

faqs.question: What support is available for medical emergencies?
faqs.answer: Up to ₹50,000 for major diseases like cancer, kidney transplants, or heart disease.

name: Institutional Support for Development and Marketing of Tribal Products/Produce
description: The scheme “Institutional Support for Development and Marketing of Tribal Products/Produce” was introduced in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India. The scheme is implemented by revising and merging existing two separate schemes - "Market Development of Tribal Products/Produce" and "Grant-in-Aid to State Tribal Development Cooperative Corporation for Minor Forest Produce Operation".The Scope:To give comprehensive support for people belonging to various tribes in the entire range of production, product development, reservation of traditional heritage, support to both forest and agricultural produce of tribal people, support to both forest and agriculture produce of tribal people, support to Institutions to carry the above activities, provision of better infrastructure, development of designs, dissemination of information about price and the agencies which are buying the products, support to Government agencies for sustainable marketing and thereby ensure a reasonable price regime.Sharing of information with Gram Panchayat and Gram SabhaSkill upgradation, development of utilitarian products for increase in value market.
benefits: Activities to be undertaken under the Scheme: Market Intervention: The various aspects of marketing intervention which will be supported under this scheme are:-fixation of equitable prices for existing products both manmade and natural;Actual procurement by State agencies as a safety net program and not monopoly/nationalization.Support during seasons of harvest when prices tend to get depressed;Sharing of information on prices so that people can make informed and conscious decisions and thereby markets become efficient;Selling of products by the State Agencies in urban areas and areas away from where they are produced to increase the demand for the products.Grading of products
Standardization
Source certification/Patent etc.Other promotional activities

Training and Skill upgradation:Training for improved production and higher-grade productsTraining related to manmade products to improve qualityDiversion to high-value productsDevelopment of improved quality and design.Linkage with other departments such as agriculture
horticulture
khadi and village industries
handlooms
and handicrafts
etc. for augmentation of training
skill upgradation

and technological support.R&D/IPR ActivityNew product development through new usageDevelopment of new products per seDevelopment of new cost-effective processes for product developmentExpansion of the market of the tribal products through R&D measuresThe IPR regime would be to document traditional knowledge and craft for seeking benefits of royalty and protection against piracyNew technologies of harvesting
scientific harvesting practices

etc. are other measures of R&DDocumentation and preservation of tangible and intangible heritage for promoting tourism etc.Supply Chain Infrastructure Development:Setting up of efficient warehousing facilities
godowns
cold storages

etc. wherever necessaryEstablishing processing industries for value addition.Sharing of information on inputs with the producers/gatherersDevelop product-specific efficient warehousing both at the IA level and also at the village levelTraining related to product-specific warehousing.Trade Information System:Capturing information about different tribal products related to the sources
types
potential
production
collection
etc.Collection and dissemination of trade information about various aspects of tribal products/web-enabled service SMS etc.In addition to the above
the following activities:Creating brands or brands for tribal produce/products
Developing product designs keeping in view the export market and support for exports.
eligibility_criteria: Support under the scheme will be made available to:Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation (TRIFED)
State Tribal Development Cooperative Corporations
State Forest Development Corporations (SDCs)
Minor Forest produce (Trading and Development) Federations (MFPTDFs)
Other institutions identified for product design
development
export processing
training of tribal producers
patenting and trademark
research
GI certification
and activities ancillary to the above.
required_documents: Registration certificate of corporation/institution/organizationDetails of the authorized share capital of the corporationPaid up share capital of the corporationDetails of the turnover of the corporation during the last three yearsDetails of the turnover expected for the current yearProfit/loss during the last three yearsYear-wise details of grants received from the Central Government so far under this scheme and UC pendingCopies of annual reports/Balance sheets for the last three yearsAny other document
as required

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the Scheme is to create institutions for the Scheduled Tribes to support marketing and development of activities they depend on for their livelihood.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched in the year 2014-15.

faqs.question: Is it a Central Sector Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a Central Sector Scheme and 100% Grant-in-aid will be provided by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs to Implementing Agencies.

faqs.question: What are the various activities to be undertaken under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The activities like Market Intervention, Training and Skill upgradation, R&D/IPR Activity, Supply Chain Infrastructure Development, Trade Information System, Creating brands or brands for tribal produce/products & Developing product designs keeping in view the export market and support for exports

faqs.question: What are the Implementing Agencies?
faqs.answer: Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation (TRIFED),State Tribal Development Cooperative Corporations, State Forest Development Corporations (SDCs),Minor Forest produce (Trading and Development) Federations (MFPTDFs),Other institutions identified for product design, development, export processing, training of tribal producers, patenting and trademark, research, GI certification, and activities ancillary to the above.

faqs.question: How can proposal be submitted under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Implementing Agencies (IA) would be responsible for preparing the proposal and detailed action plan along with budgetary requirements and submitting it to the State Tribal/Welfare Department well in advance.

name: Scheme for Pension Benefits to the Journalists/Photojournalists
description: "Scheme for Pension Benefits to the Journalists/photojournalists" was launched by the Department of Information and Cultural Affairs, Government of Tripura. The objective is to provide financial assistance in the form of a Pension to accredited Journalists/ Photojournalists aged 60 years and above. The application should be submitted to the Director of Information and Cultural Affairs Department, Government of Tripura.
benefits: Pension of ₹10
000/- per month.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be 18 years or older.The applicant retired from the job as an accredited journalist/photojournalist in Tripura.The applicant should have done 10 years of service in Tripura. The applicant should not have received a pension from other sources
except under the Employees Provident Fund (EPF).The beneficiary should be 60 years or older to receive the pension.﻿
required_documents: Two Passport-size photographs.Birth Certificate.Press Accreditation Card (Issued by the Information and Cultural Affairs Department (ICA) Tripura).Bank Passbook.Admit card (School Final Examination or Madhyamik Examination or Higher Secondary Examination or Equivalent Public Examination).Passport.Original Affidavit (Sworn before a Notary Public
stating the date of birth of the applicant).﻿

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for journalists/photojournalists to be eligible for pension benefits?
faqs.answer: Journalists/photojournalists must be at least 60 years old to be eligible for pension benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum work experience required for journalists/photojournalists under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must have a minimum of 10 years of work experience in Tripura as journalists/photojournalists.

faqs.question: Can retired journalists/photojournalists from outside Tripura apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only journalists/photojournalists with 10 years of work experience in Tripura are eligible for pension benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any exceptions to the minimum work experience requirement for journalists/photojournalists?
faqs.answer: No exceptions are made to the minimum work experience requirement for journalists/photojournalists under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any financial assistance provided other than the monthly pension under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit provided under the scheme is a monthly pension of ₹10,000.

faqs.question: Can journalists/photojournalists who have received pensions from other sources apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Journalists/photojournalists who have received pensions from other sources except under the Employees Provident Fund (EPF) are not eligible for benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any specific guidelines regarding the submission of the birth certificate?
faqs.answer: The birth certificate must be submitted as per specified guidelines to ensure accuracy and validity.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting applications under the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no specific deadline mentioned for submitting applications under the scheme.

faqs.question: What happens after the applicant submits the application?
faqs.answer: Upon receipt of the application, the concerned authority will make necessary entries in the application receipt register. Additionally, a unique identification number will be assigned to the applicant for future reference and as acknowledgement for the receipt of the application.

faqs.question: Where should the duly filled and signed application form be submitted?
faqs.answer: The applicant must submit the completed application form along with the required documents to the Director of Information and Cultural Affairs Department, Government of Tripura.

faqs.question: Can I track the status of my application online using the unique identification number?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, online tracking facilities may not be available. However, you can inquire about the status of your application by contacting the relevant authorities.

faqs.question: How long does it typically take for the authorities to assign a unique identification number after I submit my application?
faqs.answer: The unique identification number is usually assigned immediately upon submission of the application.

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for attaching the mandatory documents, such as self-attestation or notarization?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is required to self-attest all the mandatory documents before attaching them to the application form.

name: National Action Plan for Skill Development of Persons with Disabilities
description: The National Action Plan for Skill Development of Persons with Disabilities (NAP-SDP) is a dedicated skill development program aimed at providing high-quality vocational training with a focus on Persons with Disabilities (PwDs). Launched in March 2015 by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, this Central Sector Scheme operates as part of the Umbrella Scheme SIPDA (Scheme for Implementation of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act). The primary objectives of this scheme are:To enhance the skills of Persons with Disabilities by providing quality vocational skill training, enabling them to gain meaningful employment.To empower PwDs to become self-reliant, productive, and contributing members of society.
state: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
benefits: Vocational/skill training (both short-term and long-term) is provided through a network of skill training partners. These partners include the government
the public sector
training institutions such as VRCs
private training institutions
and non-governmental organizations.A cluster delivers partners' training nationwide

known for its successful track record in providing skill training with high employability rates.A dedicated cross-cutting Sector Skill Council for PwDs (SCPwD) has been established under the Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship (MSDE) in collaboration with the National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC) and the private sector.Additionally
mentorship projects to promote self-employment among PwDs are developed by DEPwD in collaboration with industrial confederations
sector-wise associations
domain experts
and other relevant organizations. These mentorship opportunities are tailored to address disability-specific needs.
eligibility_criteria: For TraineesThe applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should have a disability of not less than 40%
as defined under the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act

and any relevant legal statute.The applicant should be between 15 and 59 years of age at the commencement of the course.The applicant should not have undergone any other skill training course sponsored under the National Action Plan for Skill Development of PwDs of the Department during the one year preceding the last application date for the applied course.The applicant should enroll in courses approved by NCVET and adhere to age
qualification
and disability type specified in the QP file.
required_documents: UDID Card Number or UDID Enrolment NumberAadhar Number or Aadhar Enrolment NumberDisability CertificateProof of AgeCaste Certificate (if applicable)

faqs.question: O is responsible for developing or customizing job roles for Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) under this scheme, and what types of courses are generally provided?
faqs.answer: Sector Skill Councils for PwDs are responsible for job role development, and training is typically offered in NSQF-aligned courses developed by SCPwD and other Sector Skill Councils.

faqs.question: Can organizations enter into MOUs with specific companies to create special courses, and are assessment and certification based on specific criteria?
faqs.answer: Yes, MOUs can lead to customized courses, and assessment and certification are conducted based on National Occupational Standards (NOS).

faqs.question: What role do Employability Skills (E.S.) courses play in the training, and what are the minimum qualifications and experience required for Trainers?
faqs.answer: E.S. courses are mandatory before Domain Skills, and Trainers must meet the qualifications and experience as specified in the Qualification Pack (QP).

faqs.question: Who conducts the assessment, and what criteria are used, and what is the role of the NDFDC in monitoring training provided by training partners?
faqs.answer: Assessment is done by SCPwD or authorized agencies based on QP criteria, and NDFDC monitors training quality.

faqs.question: Can the Department inspect the premises of Training Partners, and what is the budget allocation for administrative expenses?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department can inspect premises. Administrative expenses utilize 3% of the NAP-SDP budget.

faqs.question: What are the components covered under administrative expenses, and what norms apply to the funding of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Administrative expenses include human resources, publicity, monitoring, software development, and more. The funding norms follow Common Norms for Skill Development Schemes.

faqs.question: What organizations are responsible for developing the training curriculum, and what are the requirements for linking trainee details?
faqs.answer: Sector Skill Councils for PwDs develop the curriculum, and trainee details should be linked with UDID Card numbers or enrollment numbers and disability certificates if UDID cards are unavailable.

faqs.question: How can organizations prove placements, and when will projects be canceled if they don't commence?
faqs.answer: Organizations must submit documents as proof of placements, and projects not commencing within two months from approval will be automatically canceled.

faqs.question: When does training commence, and how is the first installment of funding processed?
faqs.answer: Training can start after 7 days of commencement, and the first installment is processed after 7 days of training with biometric attendance. Training without biometric attendance or certified trainers is not valid.

faqs.question: What are the criteria for trainers to be considered valid?
faqs.answer: Trainers must be certified in the relevant domain SSC and SCPWD, as per the eligibility criteria mentioned in the course QP by NCVT.

faqs.question: Can empanelled training partners request to train new batches at validated centers?
faqs.answer: Yes, they can request to train new batches at centers that have been previously validated.

faqs.question: What documents must NGOs provide when applying for this scheme?
faqs.answer: NGOs must be registered with the NGO Portal of NITI Ayog and provide a Unique ID at the time of application for grants.

name: Varishtha Bunkar Samman Yojana
description: Launched in 2007-08, the scheme "Varishtha Bunkar Samman Yojana" by the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Development and Marketing Cooperative Union Limited, Raipur aims to encourage and honor senior weavers in the handloom sector. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹11,000/- to senior weavers who are 60 years or older and have produced the highest amount of cloth in their district. The eligible weavers must be active members of primary weaver cooperative societies affiliated with the State Handloom Union. The scheme is implemented by the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Development and Marketing Cooperative Union Limited, Raipur.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹11
000/- is provided.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be an active weaver member of the primary weaver cooperative society.The applicant should be affiliated with the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Union

Raipur.The applicant should be 60 years or older in age.One weaver from each district of the state who has produced the maximum cloth in that district.The weaver should not be a defaulter with the society.
required_documents: Passport Size PhotographAge Proof (to verify that the applicant is 60 years or older)Production Details of the Last Year (including number of pieces/meters and total weaving wages earned)Certificate from the Primary Weaver Cooperative Society confirming that the applicant is an active member and not a defaulterDetails of any Previous Awards Received (if applicable)

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance amount provided to senior weavers under this government scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹11,000/- is provided to eligible senior weavers. This amount is given to one senior weaver from each district who has produced the maximum cloth in that district.

faqs.question: When was this senior weaver honor scheme launched by the Chhattisgarh government?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched in the year 2007-08 by the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Development and Marketing Cooperative Union Limited, Raipur. It was initiated to encourage and honor senior weavers in the handloom sector.

faqs.question: Which organization is responsible for implementing this weaver honor scheme in Chhattisgarh?
faqs.answer: The Chhattisgarh State Handloom Development and Marketing Cooperative Union Limited, Raipur is responsible for implementing this scheme. They oversee the selection process and distribution of financial assistance to eligible weavers.

faqs.question: What is the minimum age requirement for a weaver to be eligible for this financial assistance program?
faqs.answer: The weaver must be 60 years or older to be eligible for this scheme. This age requirement is one of the primary eligibility criteria for senior weavers seeking to receive the financial assistance.

faqs.question: How many weavers from each district can receive the benefit under this senior weaver honor program?
faqs.answer: Only one weaver from each district who has produced the maximum cloth can receive the benefit. The scheme selects the most productive senior weaver from each district of Chhattisgarh state.

faqs.question: Must a weaver be affiliated with any particular organization to be eligible for this financial assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, the weaver must be an active member of a primary weaver cooperative society that is affiliated with the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Union, Raipur. This affiliation is a mandatory eligibility criterion.

faqs.question: What production criterion must be met by weavers to qualify for this financial honor in their district?
faqs.answer: The weaver must have produced the maximum amount of cloth in their district compared to other senior weavers. This production volume is a key criterion for selection under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the required form number for submitting an application for this weaver honor program?
faqs.answer: Applicants must submit their application in Form-1, which is the prescribed format for this scheme. This form contains fields for all necessary information about the weaver and their production details.

faqs.question: What type of photograph needs to be attached with the application form for this senior weaver program?
faqs.answer: A passport size photograph of the applicant must be attached with the application form. This is one of the required documents that must accompany the completed application.

faqs.question: Who verifies the membership status of applicants under this weaver honor scheme?
faqs.answer: The Primary Weaver Cooperative Society verifies the applicant's membership status, including their membership number and confirmation that they are an active member of the society.

faqs.question: What production details must be provided by applicants in the application for this financial assistance?
faqs.answer: Applicants must provide their production details for the last year, including the number of pieces/meters of cloth produced and the total weaving wages earned during that period.

faqs.question: Can weavers who have defaulted on their obligations with the cooperative society apply for this honor?
faqs.answer: No, weavers who are defaulters with the society are not eligible. The Primary Weaver Cooperative Society must certify that the applicant is not a defaulter as part of the verification process.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for forwarding the weaver's application to the State Handloom Union?
faqs.answer: The Primary Weaver Cooperative Society is responsible for forwarding the proposal to the Chhattisgarh State Handloom Union through the District Handloom Office. This is part of the application process.

faqs.question: Which official makes the final recommendation for weavers to be honored under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Deputy/Assistant Director of the District Handloom Office makes the recommendation for the weaver to be honored in the Union's Best Weaver Honor Ceremony. This recommendation is part of the approval process.

name: Early Intervention Centre for Children with Cerebral Palsy in SRTC, Chennai and Tiruchirapalli Districts
description: The "Early Intervention Centre for Children with Cerebral Palsy in SRTC, Chennai and Tiruchirapalli Districts" was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, stimulation training is given to the children affected with cerebral palsy in the age group of below 6 years. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the District Differently Abled Welfare Office.﻿
benefits: Early intervention provides stimulation training to the children.
eligibility_criteria: The young child/infants should be affected with cerebral palsy. The age of a young child/infant should be 6 years or below.
required_documents: National Identity Card of the Differently Abled. Birth Certificate.Any Other Document If Required.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for children eligible for the stimulation training program?
faqs.answer: The age limit for children eligible for the stimulation training program is below 6 years.

faqs.question: How can parents apply for the program?
faqs.answer: Parents can apply for the program by submitting a prescribed application form.

faqs.question: Are there specific criteria for diagnosing cerebral palsy in children?
faqs.answer: Specific criteria for diagnosing cerebral palsy in children are in place to determine eligibility.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for the program?
faqs.answer: Documents required for application include a National Identity card for differently abled individuals and a Birth Certificate.

faqs.question: Who oversees the administration of the program in Chennai and Tiruchirapalli districts?
faqs.answer: The administration of the program in Chennai and Tiruchirapalli districts is overseen by the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer.

name: Mukhyamantri Madad Yojana
description: The "Mukhyamantri Madad Yojana" scheme, launched by the Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh on 02.10.2019, aims to provide ration-related assistance to Scheduled Tribe families on the birth of a child and the death of a family member. Under this scheme, a Scheduled Tribe family receives 50kg of wheat or rice and cooking utensils from the Panchayat upon the birth of a child. In the event of a family member's death, the family is provided with 1 quintal of wheat or rice. Additionally, ₹25,000/- is allocated to each village, deposited in the bank account of the Gram Panchayat Secretary, for purchasing utensils.The scheme covers 20 identified tribal districts of Madhya Pradesh. Rice is provided in six tribal districts: Mandla, Dindori, Balaghat, Shahdol, Anuppur, and Umaria. Wheat is provided in the remaining 14 districts: Jhabua, Alirajpur, Barwani, Ratlam, Hoshangabad, Betul, Sidhi, Seoni, Chhindwara, Dhar, Khargone, Khandwa, Burhanpur, and Sheopur.

the family will receive 50 kg of wheat and rice
along with cooking utensils
provided at the panchayat level.Death of a Family Member: In the event of a family member's death
the family will receive 1 quintal (100 kg) of either wheat or rice.Note: The food grains are provided to the beneficiaries free of cost.

The objective of the scheme is to facilitate the payment of railway fares for migrant labourers employed in the organized sector in Gujarat, enabling them to travel to or from their home country to the nearest railway station. Considering the stagnant pace of industrial development in the state of Gujarat, some labourers come from other regions for livelihood. Most of these Shramyogis live away from their families. Due to social or accidental reasons, the economic burden of going to and from the labourers to their native place cannot be compensated by short salary. Hence, the plan for a labourer to visit his hometown once in two years.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Odisha?

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors are acting as Registering Officers for the registration of beneficiaries under the Board.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of Odisha.

faqs.question: Can Odia migrant workmen be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, Odia migrant workmen engaged in building and other construction works in other states can be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the registration?
faqs.answer:
To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download Form-XXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
Alternatively, registration can also be done through the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board: https://nirmanshramik.odisha.gov.in/obocwwb/public/cwLogin .

faqs.question: Is there a specific form for the registration through offline mode as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for registration must be made in Form-XXVII. You can obtain this form from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the registration process?
faqs.answer: The registration fee is ₹20/- which is payable during the registration.

faqs.question: What happens after I pay the application fee?
faqs.answer: After you pay the application fee of  ₹20/-, your application will be reviewed by the registering officer. The decision to approve or reject your application will be based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: Who decides whether my application will be approved or rejected?
faqs.answer: The registering officer is responsible for deciding whether your application will be approved or rejected based on its merits.

faqs.question: Can my application be rejected even if I have paid the application fee?
faqs.answer: Yes, your application can be rejected even if you have paid the application fee. The final decision is made by the registering officer based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the renewal of the registration?
faqs.answer: The renewal fee is ₹50/- which is payable during the renewal process of the registration.

faqs.question: What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?
faqs.answer: A nominee of a registered member is eligible for this benefit in the event of an accident causing the member to suffer a permanent total disability, loss of one limb or eye, or permanent disability without losing two limbs or eyes.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the Board shall provide ₹1,50,000/- for Permanent total disability;  ₹80,000/- for Loss of one limb/ eye; ₹40,000/- for Permanent disability without loss of two limbs/ eyes in the event of an accident in all cases.

faqs.question: What form needs to be used to apply for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: The application must be made in the prescribed Form-XXXIV. The form can be downloaded from https://bocboard.labdirodisha.gov.in/Building/homecontent/BeneficiaryForms/ACCIDENT%20Form.pdf or can be collected from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?

Alternatively , the offline application for this welfare scheme should be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area.

faqs.question: What happens if the application is rejected?
faqs.answer: In case of rejection, the applicants would be intimated about such rejection, with due intimation to the Board.

faqs.question: What are the consequences of submitting fraudulent documents for assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of receipt of assistance on the basis of fraudulent documents, the amount released towards any assistance would be recovered from the applicant under the provisions of the OPDR Act, and his/her membership would be ceased.

name: Integrated Social Security Scheme: Pension to Physically Challenged Persons
description: The scheme "Pension to Physically Challenged Persons" is a sub-component of the “Integrated Social Security Scheme (IGSSS)” implemented by the Social and Tribal Welfare Department, Administration of Union Territory of Ladakh. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹1,000/- is provided to poor physically handicapped persons (including those who are blind, deaf, or dumb) with a degree of disability 40% or above and having no source of income.
benefits: Amount of pension:  ₹1
000/- per month per beneficiary
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Ladakh.The applicant should be a physically challenged person with a disability of 40% or more (including Blind
Deaf
Dumb).The applicant should belong to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.The applicant's age should be between 18 and 79 years.The applicant should have no source of income.
required_documents: 1.	Passport-size Photograph2.	Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar card3.	Proof of Age4.	Proof of Income5.	Disability certificate6.	Proof of Status: Below Poverty Line (BPL) category7.	Address Proof8.	Bank account details/Bank Passbook9.	Any other documents as required

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this pension scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of the Union Territory of Ladakh who are physically challenged with a disability of 40% or more, belong to the BPL category, aged between 18 and 79 years, and have no source of income are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the amount of financial assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receive ₹1,000 per month.

faqs.question: When are the pension payments released?
faqs.answer: Payments are released by the 8th of every month for the previous month, within 3 working days after release by the Treasury.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the pension offline?
faqs.answer: Visit the office of the concerned Tehsil Social Welfare Officer (TSWO) and collect the application form, which is available free of cost.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the pension online?
faqs.answer: Visit the ‘Ladakh E-Seva Platform’: https://eseva.ladakh.gov.in/ladakheservices.

faqs.question: What should I do if I do not receive my pension by the 8th of the month?
faqs.answer: Raise a complaint either via email at directorsocialwelfareladakh@gmail.com or physically at the Directorate of Social and Tribal Welfare, Ground Floor, Council Secretariat, Kurbathang, Kargil-194103.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant's age should be between 18 and 79 years.

faqs.question: Are there any income criteria to qualify for the pension?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must have no source of income.

faqs.question: Can I check the status of my application online?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can check the status by visiting the ‘Ladakh E-Seva Platform’.

faqs.question: How frequently is the pension disbursed?
faqs.answer: The pension is disbursed monthly.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable to non-residents of Ladakh?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for permanent residents of the Union Territory of Ladakh.

name: Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojana
description: Launched by the Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand, “Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojana” aims to provide social security to differently abled people aged five(5) years and above who are unable to sustain themselves with their own resources and are in need of financial assistance. It is a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) scheme, so pension the amount will be directly transferred to the bank account of the beneficiary.﻿
benefits: Amount: ₹ 1
000/- per month to the eligible beneficiary.﻿﻿
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Jharkhand.The applicant should have attained the age of five (5) years or more.The applicant must belong to any of the following categories:Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act

2016 Section-2 (r) benchmark disability.Section-2 (s) Persons with Disabilities.Section-2 (t) Persons with Disability having high support needs.Section-2 (zc) "Specified Disability”.The applicant should have a Voter ID card and Aadhar Card (For applicant’s aged 18 years and above)The applicant should not be a beneficiary under any other Social Security pension scheme.The applicant should not be retired or permanently employed in Central and State Government or in public sector undertakings.The applicant or their spouse should not be a recipient of any family pension or pension from Central and State Government or from public sector undertakings.Applicant’s family is not an income tax payee.﻿
required_documents: Photocopy of disability related certificate.Age proof (in case
applicants age is less than 18 years
Birth certificate or Attested Copy from the Headmaster/Principal is required).Copy of Voter ID card (in case
applicants age is 18 years or more).Copy Aadhar Card (in case the applicant does not have an Aadhar Card they need to submit a Self-declaration).Copy of Bank Passbook.﻿

faqs.question: What is Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojona?
faqs.answer: Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojona provides social security to differently abled people aged five(5) years and above.

faqs.question: Which department has launched Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojona?
faqs.answer: Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojona has been launched by the Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand.

faqs.question: What is the primary criteria to be eligible for Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojona?
faqs.answer: Differently abled people aged five(5) years and above are eligible for this scheme along with other conditions.

faqs.question: What is the rate and periodicity of the pension?
faqs.answer: The monthly pension is ₹1000/-.

faqs.question: Is the pension provided in cash?
faqs.answer: No, the pension amount is transferred directly to the individual's bank account.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Photocopy of disability related certificate, Age proof, Copy of Voter ID card, Aadhar card, Bank passbook are the necessary documents.

faqs.question: Is there an income criterion for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, income is not a criterion, however, not receiving any other pension is a prerequisite.

faqs.question: Can a widow avail Mukhyamantri Rajya Nirashrit Mahila Samman Pension Yojana?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as they meet the eligibility criteria and do not receive any other pension, widows are eligible.

faqs.question: Is there a provision for retroactive pension payment if the application is delayed?
faqs.answer: No, pension payment starts from the date of approval; there is no provision for retroactive payments for delayed applications.

faqs.question: What if an applicant does not possess an Aadhar Card?
faqs.answer: In case the applicant does not have an Aadhar Card they need to submit a Self-declaration stating that they do not have an Aadhar Card.

name: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance
description: Launched in April 1999, "Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance" is a scheme by the Chief Minister's Secretariat, Govt. of Rajasthan. In case of death due to accident, ₹ 1,00,000 is provided to the dependent of the deceased. In case of serious injury, assistance should be approved up to ₹ 20,000, keeping in view the seriousness of the injury to the ordinary injured. A revolving fund of ₹20,00,000 each has been made available to all district collectors. The assistance is "one-time full-support" and is sanctioned by the concerned District Collector. For assistance, one has to apply either to the Tehsil/District Collector's Office or to the Chief Minister's Office.

faqs.question: When Was The Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund Launched?
faqs.answer: The Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund was launched in April 1999.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided In Case Of "Death Due To Accident"?
faqs.answer: In case of death due to an accident, ₹ 1,00,000 is provided to the dependent of the deceased.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided In Case Of "Serious Injury"?
faqs.answer: In case of serious injury, assistance should be approved up to ₹ 20,000, keeping in view the seriousness of the injury to the ordinary injured.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Revolving Fund That Has Been Made Available To The District Collectors Of Rajasthan?
faqs.answer: A revolving fund of ₹20,00,000 each has been made available to all district collectors.

faqs.question: Is The Amount Of Financial Assistance Provided As A Lump Sum Or In Installments?
faqs.answer: The assistance is "one-time full-support" and is provided as lumpsum.

faqs.question: Who Sanctions The Amount Of Financial Assistance?
faqs.answer: The amount of financial assistance is sanctioned by the concerned District Collector.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines can be found at this link - https://jankalyan.rajasthan.gov.in/#/scheme/detail/435
