faqs.question: What Is The Official Email ID Of The Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund?
faqs.answer: The official Email ID of the Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund is: cmrf.cmo@rajasthan.gov.in

faqs.question: In What Case Is A Satisfaction Certificate Of The Inquest Officer Mandatory?
faqs.answer: In case of mutilation of the dead body, the satisfaction certificate of the inquest officer is mandatory.

faqs.question: Is The FIR Report Mandatory In Order To Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the FIR Report is a mandatory document.

faqs.question: What Is The Address Of The Chief Accounts Officer (CAO) Of Govt. Of Rajasthan?
faqs.answer: The address of the Chief Accounts Officer (CAO) is: Room No. 301, Chief Minister's Office, Government Secretariat, Jaipur, Rajasthan - 302 005.

name: Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities
description: The "Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities" aims to empower individuals facing mobility challenges due to disabilities. Launched in 2020 by the Government of Uttar Pradesh, the program provides free motorized tricycles to those struggling to integrate into society due to physical limitations. This initiative seeks to facilitate their economic and social rehabilitation, granting them greater independence and participation in daily life.﻿Eligibility for the program is determined by several factors. Individuals suffering from conditions like muscular dystrophy, stroke, cerebral palsy, or hemophilia may qualify, provided they meet specific criteria. These include good eyesight, mental capacity, and sufficient upper body strength to operate the tricycle while seated. Additionally, the applicant must have a disability certified by the Chief Medical Officer of their district at a minimum of 80%.
benefits: The maximum grant amount under this scheme is the motorized actual price of tricycles or ₹25
000/- whichever minimum per person with disabilities will be permissible.Note: If the cost of a motorized bicycle exceeds ₹25
the expenditure incurred in addition to the maximum grant amount of ₹25
000/- will be borne by the beneficiary himself.
eligibility_criteria: Beneficiary should be resident of Uttar Pradesh.Beneficiary age should be 16 old or above.Family annual income must not be exceed ₹1

000/- from all the sources. Beneficiary can get the benefits only at once. Beneficiary must not be previously benefited by a motorized tricycle from the Government of India/Local Bodies/Member of Legislative Assembly Fund/MPLADS or other Government or Government funded sources.Applicants must have disability of 80% or more and certified by the Chief Medical Officer of the district.﻿
required_documents: Passport-size photographDisability Certificate Domicile Certificate Income Certificate Aadhaar CardCaste Certificate Educational certificate (Mandatory only for Student)If required attach other certificates ﻿

faqs.question: What is the "Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities" in Uttar Pradesh?
faqs.answer: This scheme, launched by the Government of Uttar Pradesh in 2020, aims to provide free motorized tricycles to individuals with disabilities who face challenges in integrating into mainstream society due to their disabilities.

faqs.question: What is the objective of providing motorized tricycles?
faqs.answer: The primary goal is to facilitate the mobility of persons with disabilities who are unable to connect with mainstream society due to their impairments. The provision of free motorized tricycles aims to enhance their accessibility and independence.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Individuals with disabilities who encounter difficulties in societal integration due to their impairments are eligible for the scheme. Economic and social rehabilitation criteria are essential for consideration.

faqs.question: What is the maximum grant amount under the Motorized Tricycle Scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum grant amount is either the actual price of the motorized tricycle or ₹25,000/-, whichever is higher, as permissible for each person with disabilities.

faqs.question: Can individuals from outside Uttar Pradesh avail of the benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only residents of Uttar Pradesh are eligible to benefit from the Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities.

faqs.question: How many times can an eligible person with a disability benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: An eligible person with a disability can benefit from a motorized tricycle only once in a lifetime.

faqs.question: What are the required documents?
faqs.answer: Applicants should submit Passport-size photograph, Disability certificate, Domicile certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Caste certificate, Educational certificate.

faqs.question: How can apply for the Motorized Tricycle Grant?
faqs.answer: The online application form can be found on the prescribed web portal: https://hwd.uphq.in/.

faqs.question: Is there any percentage of disability?
faqs.answer: Yes, the disability is certified by the Chief Medical Officer of the concerned district at least 80% or more.

faqs.question: What documents do I need to submit with my application?
faqs.answer:
Passport-size photograph
Disability Certificate 
Domicile Certificate 
Income Certificate 
Aadhaar Card
Caste Certificate 
Educational certificate (Mandatory only for Students)
If required attach other certificates

name: Sweekruti: Assistance to Parents of Transgender Children
description: The scheme "Assistance to Parents of Transgenders" is a component of the “Sweekruti” scheme, implemented by the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (SSEPD) Department, Government of Odisha. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the parents of transgender children to support them in successfully raising their children against societal intolerance, stigma, discrimination, and violence.
benefits: Financial assistance: ₹1
500/- per transgender child per month.Note: Assistance is provided until the child reaches the age of 18 years.In case of death of the parent
supportive money will be made available to the guardian subject to production of the relevant Certificate of guardianship obtained from Competent Authority. ﻿
eligibility_criteria: Applicant should be the parents/ guardian of the transgender child.The child must be under 18 years of age.The child should have gender non-conforming behavior.﻿
required_documents: Affidavit certifying the child's gender non-conforming behavior.Birth certificate or any age proof of the child.In case of guardian
a certificate of guardianship from a Competent Authority.Note: Parents must certify on an affidavit that they have a child showing gender non-conforming behavior.﻿

faqs.question: What is the "Assistance to Parents of Transgenders" scheme?
faqs.answer: The "Assistance to Parents of Transgenders" scheme is a component of the “Sweekruti” scheme by the Social Security and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (SSEPD) Department, Government of Odisha, that provides financial assistance to parents of transgender children to support them in raising their children against societal intolerance, stigma, discrimination, and violence.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹1,500/- per transgender child per month until the child reaches the age of 18 years.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this financial assistance?
faqs.answer:
The following eligibility criteria must be met:
The child must be under 18 years of age.
The child should exhibit gender non-conforming behavior.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to certify gender non-conforming behavior?
faqs.answer: Parents must provide an affidavit certifying that their child shows gender non-conforming behavior.

faqs.question: What happens if the parent passes away?
faqs.answer: In the event of the parent’s death, supportive money will be made available to the guardian, provided a Certificate of Guardianship from a Competent Authority is submitted.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process the application?
faqs.answer: Processing times may vary, but you can inquire about the expected timeline when you submit your application at the Block/ ULB Administration office.

faqs.question: Can I apply for multiple children under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, parents can apply for financial assistance for each transgender child who meets the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: What if my application is rejected?
faqs.answer: If your application is rejected, you will receive a notice explaining the reasons. You can rectify the issues and reapply or appeal the decision as per the guidelines provided.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my application?
faqs.answer: You can check the status of your application by visiting the Block/ ULB Administration office or contacting them directly for updates.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for parents applying for this assistance?
faqs.answer: There is no specific age limit for parents applying for this assistance, but they must be the legal guardians of the transgender child.

faqs.question: Who can I contact for further assistance or questions regarding the scheme?
faqs.answer: For further assistance, you can contact the Block/ ULB Administration office or reach out to the DSSO office of your area for any queries related to the scheme.

name: Free Distribution of Blankets and Chappals to Senior Citizen
description: The scheme “Free Distribution of Blankets and Chappals to Senior Citizen" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to enable the poor senior citizens, aged 60 years and above and residing in Puducherry, to receive blankets and chappals. The applicant should be a recipient of Old Age Pension.﻿
benefits: One Blanket and One Pair of Chappals Every Year.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a Native/Resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry.The age of the applicant should be 60 years or above.The applicant should be a recipient of Old Age Pension.
required_documents: Aadhaar Card.Residence-cum-nativity Certificate
Issued by the Competent Authority.Recent Passport-size Photograph.Bank Passbook.Address Proof.Age Proof.Ration Card.

faqs.question: How often can a beneficiary avail of the benefits?
faqs.answer: A beneficiary is entitled to receive one blanket and one pair of chappals every year.

faqs.question: Can a person below 60 years receive benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant must be 60 years or above to qualify for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is the scheme limited to residents of a specific area?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is for residents of the Union Territory of Puducherry.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiaries receive one blanket and one pair of chappals every year.

faqs.question: Where should I submit my application for the scheme?
faqs.answer:
Submit your application to:
Puducherry: The Field Officer, Social Defence Section.
Karaikal: The Assistant Director, Social Welfare Department (Sub Office).
Mahe/Yanam: The Welfare Officer (i\c), Social Welfare Department (Sub office).

faqs.question: Whom should I contact if there is a delay in receiving the benefits of the "Free Distribution of Blankets and Chappals to Senior Citizen" scheme in Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, or Yanam?
faqs.answer:
Contact the authorities listed below:
Puducherry: The Director, Directorate of Social Welfare.
Karaikal: The Collector.
Mahe/Yanam: The Regional Administrator.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting applications each year?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines do not specify a deadline, but timely submission is recommended for prompt processing.

faqs.question: Can a senior citizen apply for the scheme if they are not receiving Old Age Pension?
faqs.answer: No, being a recipient of Old Age Pension is a mandatory eligibility criterion.

faqs.question: How can individuals address grievances related to the scheme?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be addressed through the Grievance Redressal portal at https://pgportal.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Where can individuals find contact information for direct inquiries?
faqs.answer: For direct inquiries, individuals can refer to the "Contact Us" section at https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/contact-us.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, applicants can rest assured that the entire application process is entirely free of cost. There are no fees associated with applying for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any provision for compensation in the event of delayed disbursement of scheme benefits. Applicants should note that compensation for delays is not part of the scheme's framework.

name: Vivah Sahayata Yojana
description: "Vivah Sahayata Yojana" is a scheme by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development Govt of Jharkhand. This is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme. Only the residents/domicile of the state of Jharkhand can apply to this scheme. Applications for this scheme are accepted online through the official website of the department. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 30,000/- (Rupees Thirty Thousand Only) rupees for the marriage of two children / female members of the family.
benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 30
000/- (Rupees Thirty Thousand Only) rupees for the marriage of two children / female members of the family.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a domicile in the state of Jharkhand.The applicant should be a Worker registered with the 'Jharkhand Building and Other Construction Worker Welfare Board (JBOCWW Board)'.The applicant should be between 18-60 years of age.The applicant should be engaged in construction work such as masons
carpenters
electricians
porters
painters

etc.The registered worker should have made continuous contributions for five years. The bride should be at least 18 years of age. The groom should be at least 21 years of age.The scheme is applicable for up to two children / female members of the family.
required_documents: Aadhaar Card of the Registered WorkerAadhaar Card of the Bride and the GroomResidential Certificate / Domicile CertificateProof of IdentityeSHRAM CardPassport Sized PhotographProof of Registration as a Construction WorkerDetails of the Bank Account of the Registered WorkerIncome Certificate of the Registered WorkerMarriage CertificateProof of Age of the Bride and the Groom

faqs.question: Which Department Manages This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development, Govt. of Jharkhand.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme State Sponsored Or Centrally Sponsored?
faqs.answer: This scheme is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The Scheme Guidelines?
faqs.answer: The Scheme Guidelines can be found at this link - https://shramadhan.jharkhand.gov.in/schemmeDetailsShow.action

faqs.question: Can Women Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is open to applicants from all genders.

faqs.question: Does This Scheme Accept Offline Applications?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme only accepts online applications. In order to apply, please register yourself on the Official website of Comprehensive Labour Management System for Factory Establishment / Worker Registration / Inspection / Management & Grievance Redressal; Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development; Govt. of Jharkhand.

faqs.question: What Is The URL Of The Website Of Comprehensive Labour Management System For Factory Establishment/Worker Registration/Inspection/Management & Grievance Redressal?
faqs.answer: The URL of the website of Comprehensive Labour Management System for Factory Establishment / Worker Registration / Inspection / Management & Grievance Redressal is https://shramadhan.jharkhand.gov.in/home.

faqs.question: What Details Are Required To Register On The Portal?
faqs.answer: The following details are required to register on the portal - First Name, Last Name, Email, Mobile, Username and Password.

faqs.question: What Details Are Needed To Be Provided In The "Basic Details" Section Of The Application Form?
faqs.answer: The following details are needed to be provided in the "Basic Details" section of the Application Form: BOC Registration Number, Applicant's Name, Applicant's Father's Name / Husband's Name, Applicant's Date of Birth, Applicant's Aadhaar Number, District, Sex.

faqs.question: How Do I Know If A Field Is Mandatory?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields are marked with a "Red Asterisk" (*) at the end.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: How Do I Track The Status Of My Application?
faqs.answer: To track the status of your application, follow the stepwise process given below: Step 1: Once submitted, the application goes for 3-level approval: Clerk > Labour Superintendent > DLC. Step 2: Go to Services > BOC Scheme Benefit > Application Status. Step 3: On the next page, fill in your Application ID, and click "Search". The status of your application will be displayed in a tabular format: Application ID, Applicant Name, Scheme Applied, Application Status, Remarks, Date, and Time. Step 4: Once the DLC approves the application, the "Application Status" changes to "Approved". The Applicant can take print of this page by clicking “PRINT” and submit the same at the Labour Office to avail of the scheme benefit.

faqs.question: How Many Schemes Can Be Selected At A Time From The List Of Schemes In The Application Form?
faqs.answer: The application form allows only one scheme to be selected per application.

faqs.question: Is There A Percentage Of Slots Reserved For Female Applicants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no reservation of slots based on the gender of the applicant.

faqs.question: By When Can The Applicant Receive The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The benefits are due within three months of registration.

faqs.question: Can A Person Who Is Domiciled In Madhya Pradesh Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is open to applicants who are domiciled in the state of Jharkhand.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For The Applicant To Be A Registered Construction Worker (Nirman Shramik) In Order To Be Eligible To Apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, in order to be eligible to apply, the applicant should be a Registered Construction Worker (Nirman Shramik).

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Link To The User Manual Of The Application Process?
faqs.answer: The User Manual of the Application Process can be found at this link - https://shramadhan.jharkhand.gov.in/ftp/WebAdmin/documents/BOC_SCHEME_BENEFIT_APPLICANT_SIDE.pdf

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of JBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Jharkhand Building and Other Construction Worker Welfare Board (JBOCWW Board).

name: Jagananna Chedodu
description: "Jagananna Chedodu" is a State-Funded Social Welfare Scheme by the B.C. Welfare Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh. The scheme is only for tailors (All communities), Rajakas (washermen), and Nayee Brahmins (Barbers) of the state. The beneficiary will be provided a one-time amount of ₹ 10,000 per year for a period of 5 years i.e., ₹ 50,000/- in five installments. This fund can be utilized by the beneficiaries for purchasing tools, equipment, and other essentials to grow their source of income and work establishment. The Functionary Responsible for Scheme Delivery is/are Welfare & Education & Assistant / Ward Welfare & Development Secretary at Village/Ward secretariats level. At the district level, the Executive Director, of BC Corporation will coordinate with the assistance of MPDOs / Municipal Commissioner.

name: Pension Benefit (GBOCWWB)
description: "Pension Benefit (GBOCWWB)" is a Welfare Scheme by the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of the Department of Labour and Employment, Goa. Through this scheme, a member of the Fund who has been working as a building worker for not less than one year, be eligible for a pension of ₹300/- per month, on completion of sixty years of age. The applications are accepted offline.
benefits: Pension of ₹300/- per month
with an increase of ₹10/- for every completed year of service beyond 5 years.*The pension will be payable from the first day of the succeeding month to the month in which he/she becomes 60 years old.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be registered as a 'Building Worker' for not less than one year with the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The applicant should be a member of the Fund of the Board.

faqs.question: Who oversees the operations of the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: The Labour Commissioner of Goa serves as both the Member Secretary and the Chief Executive Officer of the GBOCWWB.

faqs.question: How can one apply for registration of establishments employing building workers in Goa?
faqs.answer: Employers can apply for registration through the Labour Department's online portal by filling out Form-1 and paying the applicable fee based on the number of workers proposed to be employed.

faqs.question: What is the age-related eligibility criteria for registration under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The age of the worker should be between 18 to 60 years of age in order to be eligible for registration.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria regarding the service period for registration under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The worker should have completed 90 days of service in the year in order to be eligible for registration.

faqs.question: Can a worker who is also a member of some other fund register under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: No, a worker who is also a member of some other fund is not eligible to register under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa.

faqs.question: How long is the validity of the registration certificate issued under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The registration certificate issued is valid until the contract is in force and is not renewable or transferable.

faqs.question: Who are the registering officers responsible for processing applications under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act in Goa?
faqs.answer: The Deputy Labour Commissioners for North and South districts have been designated as registering officers under the Act.

faqs.question: Who serves as the First Appellate Authority for matters related to the Labour Department in Goa?
faqs.answer: The Commissioner of Labour & Employment acts as the First Appellate Authority for matters related to the Labour Department in Goa. Citizens can contact the First Appellate Authority, at Shramshakti Bhavan, Patto Plaza, Panaji, Goa, or through the provided contact details.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for registration of establishments employing building workers in Goa?
faqs.answer: The fee varies based on the number of workers proposed to be employed, ranging from ₹500 for up to 50 workers to ₹5,000 for exceeding 400 workers.

faqs.question: Can registration under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act be transferred or renewed?
faqs.answer: No, the registration certificate issued under the Act is neither renewable nor transferable.

faqs.question: What are the consequences of non-compliance with the registration requirements under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act?
faqs.answer: Non-compliance may result in penalties or legal action, as outlined in the Act and its rules.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for approving applications for registration under the Building and Other Construction Workers Act?
faqs.answer: The Deputy Labour Commissioner (Registering Authority) reviews and approves the applications after ensuring compliance with the required documents and criteria.

faqs.question: What is the Death Benefit Scheme?
faqs.answer: Death Benefit Scheme introduced by the Assam Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Welfare Department, Government of Assam. It provides financial assistance to the nominees/dependents of registered construction workers in the unfortunate event of the worker's death, whether it occurs due to natural causes during employment or as a result of an accident on the job.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to avail the Death Benefit under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The nominees or dependents of a registered construction worker, as recognized by the A.B.O.C.W.W.B., are eligible to avail of the Death Benefit in case of the worker's normal death during the course of employment or death due to an accident on the job.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided under the Scheme for a normal death during employment?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers a financial assistance of ₹50,000/- to the nominees or dependents of a registered construction worker in the event of the worker's normal death during the course of employment.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided if the registered worker's death is a result of an accident during employment?
faqs.answer: In case of the worker's death due to an accident during the course of employment, the scheme provides financial assistance of ₹3,00,000/- to the nominee or dependents of the registered construction worker.

faqs.question: Can non-residents of Assam apply for the Death Benefit under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only permanent residents of Assam are eligible to apply for the Death Benefit.

faqs.question: What kinds of construction work are considered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers individuals engaged in any building and other construction work.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for the deceased worker to be registered with the A.B.O.C.W.W.B.?
faqs.answer: Yes, the deceased worker must have been registered with the Assam Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: Can the Death Benefit be availed if the deceased worker's membership with the Board was not active at the time of death?
faqs.answer: No, the deceased worker should have had an active membership with the A.B.O.C.W.W.B. at the time of death.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply through the official portal. https://abocwwb.assam.gov.in/

Recognizing the distinct challenges faced by this population group in securing suitable employment, the program seeks to alleviate the economic burdens associated with unemployment and foster self-sufficiency during their job search. This intervention ultimately contributes to a more inclusive workforce by empowering differently-abled individuals to actively pursue their career goals.

faqs.question: What is the definition of a Migrant Worker?
faqs.answer: “Migrant Worker’ means a person of the age in between 18 to 60 years who is, by origin, a resident of West Bengal and employed in a remunerated activity in any State/Union Territories in India other than West Bengal.

faqs.answer: The Scheme will be implemented and monitored by the Labour Department through Labour Commissionerate.

faqs.question: What process will be followed by the department for the administration of the Welfare Assistance?
faqs.answer: All Assistant Labour Commissioners are authorised to verify, administer and sanction claims for assistance under this Scheme within their respective jurisdiction on the basis of criteria as decided by the Board.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent misuse of the Welfare Assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of any misrepresentation of facts or furnishing false information by a Migrant Worker, the registration obtained, may subsequently be cancelled by the registering authority with the approval of the Board, without showing any reason and in such case, all his/ her claims under the scheme shall be revoked.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: "West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Death Assistance" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Board, Labour Department, Government of West Bengal, that provides an one time assistance to the nominee in case of natural death/accidental death of the registered migrant worker.

faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 25th April, 2023.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme?

faqs.question: What kind of assistance can be availed through this scheme?

faqs.question: How can the benefits be availed?

faqs.question: What is the frequency of the assistance?
faqs.answer: The assistance will be provided one time to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Is there any provision of renewal of registration as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, Migrant Worker, registered as beneficiary, will have to renew his/ her registration on yearly basis, through the portal.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Odisha?

faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors are acting as Registering Officers for the registration of beneficiaries under the Board.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of Odisha.

faqs.question: Can Odia migrant workmen be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board?

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the registration?
faqs.answer:
To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download Form-XXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
Alternatively, registration can also be done through the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board: https://nirmanshramik.odisha.gov.in/obocwwb/public/cwLogin .

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the registration process?

faqs.question: What happens after I pay the application fee?

faqs.question: Who decides whether my application will be approved or rejected?
faqs.answer: The registering officer is responsible for deciding whether your application will be approved or rejected based on its merits.

faqs.question: Can my application be rejected even if I have paid the application fee?
faqs.answer: Yes, your application can be rejected even if you have paid the application fee. The final decision is made by the registering officer based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the renewal of the registration?
faqs.answer: The renewal fee is ₹50/- which is payable during the renewal process of the registration.

faqs.question: What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?
faqs.answer: A nominee of a deceased registered member of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Odisha, shall be eligible for this benefit.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the Board shall provide ₹5,000/- for funeral assistance.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?

faqs.question: Can a craftsperson's spouse continue to receive benefits after the beneficiary's demise?

faqs.question: How long does the financial assistance continue for the beneficiary under this scheme?

name: Scheme for Grant of Pension Benefits to Journalists
description: The "Scheme for Grant of Pension Benefits to Journalists" by the Department of Information & Publicity, Union Territory of Puducherry, aims to provide financial support and recognition to eligible media professionals. The scheme offers a monthly pension of ₹6,000/- to qualified journalists who are 58 years or above in age, and have served for a minimum of 20 years in roles such as Full-time Editor, Reporter, Sub-Editor, Press Photographer / Videographer / Correspondent.
benefits: Pension Amount: ₹6
000/- per month
or as may be fixed by the Government from time to time.Date of Payment: Payment will be made on the 10th of every month.Mode of Payment: Payment will be made through the Electronic Clearing System.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be a native of the Union Territory of Puducherry by birth or by continuous residence for not less than ten years.The applicant should be 58 years or above in age at the time of application.The applicant should have served for a minimum of 20 years in roles such as Full-time Editor
Reporter
Sub-Editor
Press Photographer / Videographer / Correspondent of a Newspaper/Periodical/News Agency/Electronic Media

including Newspapers and Periodicals published in Puducherry and News Agencies/Electronic Media having headquarters outside Puducherry. In the case of Media Persons who are unable to pursue their profession on account of chronic ill-health or are permanently incapacitated from performing their job
the pension shall be sanctioned if they have put in service for at least 10 years in any capacity (as mentioned in Point 4)
irrespective of their present age
if they meet all the other eligibility criteria.The applicant should not be receiving pension/honoraria from the Central/State Government.In the case of the death of the journalist
his/her spouse is eligible for 50%)of the pension.
required_documents: For the ApplicantNativity/Nationality/Residence Certificate (Form-II)
from an officer of the Revenue Department not below the rank of a Deputy Tahsildar. Income Certificate (Form-II)

from an officer of the Revenue Department not below the rank of a Deputy Tahsildar. Birth Certificate or Transfer Certificate/School Leaving Certificate.Experience Certificate (Form-II).Certificate regarding pensions/honoraria received from other schemes.Medical Certificate for Physically Handicapped or those with incurable diseases.Aadhaar Card.For the BeneficiaryThe 'Life Certificate' should be produced every year to the effect that he/she is alive to avail of the benefit.

faqs.question: Can media persons suffering from chronic ill-health or permanent incapacitation apply for pension benefits, and if so, what are the conditions?
faqs.answer: Yes, media persons unable to pursue their profession due to chronic ill-health or permanent incapacitation may apply for pension benefits if they have completed at least 10 years of service, irrespective of their present age. Other eligibility conditions still apply.

faqs.question: What is the quantum of pension provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The quantum of pension under the Scheme for Grant of Pension Benefits to Journalists is ₹6,000 per month, subject to adjustments as fixed by the government from time to time.

faqs.question: When does the pension become payable, and what is the mode of payment?
faqs.answer: Pension becomes payable from the first month of sanction and is due at the end of each month. Payments are made on the 10th of each month through the Electronic Clearing System.

faqs.question: Can you provide details on the circumstances under which the Director of Information and Publicity has the right to stop the payment of pension?
faqs.answer: The Director of Information and Publicity can stop the payment of pension if it is found that the pension was sanctioned on mistaken grounds, false information was provided, or the conditions for granting the pension no longer exist. Before stopping the pension, the pensioner is entitled to an opportunity to be heard either in person or in writing.

faqs.question: What happens if the pensioner or family pensioner passes away before receiving the pension for a particular period?
faqs.answer: If the pensioner or family pensioner passes away before receiving the pension for a specific period, the unpaid amount for that period shall be lapsed.

faqs.question: Is there an appeal process available for pensioners who are aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner-cum-Secretary to the Government of Puducherry (Information and Publicity)?
faqs.answer: Yes, any pensioner aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner-cum-Secretary to the Government of Puducherry (Information and Publicity) may appeal to the Chief Secretary to the Government of Puducherry, and the decision of the Chief Secretary shall be final.

faqs.question: How is "Electronic Media" defined in the scheme?
faqs.answer: "Electronic Media" refers to Audio and Visual Media units engaged in Broadcasting/Telecasting of News and registered with the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, Government of India, New Delhi.

faqs.question: How are "Newspapers/Periodicals" defined in the context of the scheme?
faqs.answer: "Newspapers/Periodicals" refer to any newspaper/periodical duly registered with the Registrar of Newspapers of India, Government of India, New Delhi.

faqs.question: How is the sanctioning process documented and maintained?
faqs.answer: The Director of Information and Publicity, Puducherry, maintains a Register of sanction in Form-V for pension. This register serves as an official record of all sanctioned pensions, providing transparency and accountability in the administration of the scheme.

faqs.question: How is "Family" defined under the scheme?
faqs.answer: "Family" refers to the Media Person and his/her wife/husband and children excluding major children. Major children are those who are independent and separated from their parents.

faqs.question: How does the scheme accommodate individuals who may not have an Experience Certificate in Form-II?
faqs.answer: In cases where Media persons are unable to produce an Experience Certificate in Form-II, the Assistant Director of the concerned section can provide the necessary certificate based on records available in the Department. This ensures a flexible approach in recognizing the service history of applicants.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Revenue Department in the application process?
faqs.answer: The Revenue Department plays a crucial role in the application process by providing the Nationality/Nativity/Residence and Income certificate, which is a prerequisite for applying for pension under the scheme.

name: Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Shramik Pension Sahayata
description: Labor Department of Chhattisgarh State started this scheme "Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Shramik Pension Sahayata" for Building and other construction worker on 29 March 2023.. The main objective of the scheme to provides financial assistance to compensate the loss in regular income of the beneficiary due to lack of work available to him every day and to ensure smooth functioning of his livelihood.
benefits: Pension to the Beneficiary : ₹ 1
500/- per month (or)Pension to the widow of the beneficiary: ₹ 700/-  per month.﻿
eligibility_criteria: Beneficiaries should be 60 years old or more. Beneficiaries must be permanent residents of Chhattisgarh.Beneficiaries must have registered members as construction workers in the Board for 10 years.Beneficiaries cannot receive benefits under this scheme if they are already receiving benefits from any other parallel scheme of the State/Central Government.Registered construction workers who have availed the benefit of the Chief Minister Syan Sahayata Yojana are ineligible for this scheme.Beneficiaries must submit a survival certificate every year in March to continue receiving the assistance amount.If both husband and wife are registered workers and both are receiving pension benefits

the wife will receive family pension until she turns 60. After turning 60
she can apply for pension under the pension scheme

name: Sanction of Adult Sticks to Senior Citizens
description: The "Sanction of Adult Sticks to Senior Citizens" scheme aims to provide walking sticks to senior citizens. The A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation, Andhra Pradesh, under its Action Plan 2017-18. The walking sticks are distributed by the Assistant Directors, Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled & Senior Citizens, and District Managers, A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation.
benefits: Distribution of Adult Sticks. Category I: Parent/Guardian income up to ₹15
000/- per month – full cost covered.Category II: Parent/Guardian income from ₹15
000/- per month – half of the cost covered.Category III: Parent/Guardian income above ₹20
000/- per month – full cost to be borne by the beneficiary.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant's age should be 60 years and above.The applicant should not have availed the benefit of this scheme earlier.
required_documents: Income Certificate.Medical Recommendation (not below the rank of Assistant Civil Surgeon Certificate).Aadhaar Card.  Cell/Mobile Number.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive a walking stick under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Senior citizens aged 60 years or older who meet the income and medical recommendation criteria.

faqs.question: How is the cost of the walking stick determined for different income groups?
faqs.answer: Full cost covered for incomes up to ₹15,000 per month, half the cost for incomes between ₹15,001 and ₹20,000 per month, and full cost for incomes above ₹20,001 per month.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for a walking stick?
faqs.answer: Income certificate, medical recommendation from an Assistant Civil Surgeon or higher authority, Aadhar card, and cell number.

faqs.question: How often can an individual receive a walking stick under this scheme?
faqs.answer: An individual can receive a walking stick once in their lifetime.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for distributing the walking sticks?

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent double or false claims?
faqs.answer: Records of beneficiaries are maintained to avoid double or false claims, and verification is conducted before approval.

faqs.question: Can the walking stick be transferred to another person?
faqs.answer: No, the walking stick is issued to the individual and is non-transferable.

faqs.question: Is there an application deadline for receiving a walking stick?
faqs.answer: Applications are received throughout the year, and eligible requests are processed as they come.

faqs.question: What happens if the walking stick is damaged or requires maintenance?
faqs.answer: Maintenance and repair responsibilities are usually not covered by the scheme; beneficiaries should refer to the guidelines or contact the distribution office for specific assistance.

faqs.question: What are the legal implications if incorrect information is found in the application at a later date?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary is liable for legal action by the Corporation and must return the walking stick or the cost of the instrument.

name: Cost of Hearing Aid for the Construction Workers
description: The “Cost of Hearing Aid for the Construction Workers” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, West Bengal, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of West Bengal?
faqs.answer: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: At present all Assistant Labour Commissioners and Inspectors posted at blocks and municipalities shall be responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of West Bengal.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the registration?
faqs.answer: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should collect and submit Form-27 with all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers.

faqs.question: Is there a specific form for the registration as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for registration must be made in Form-27. You can obtain this form from the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers in your area.

faqs.question: What happens after a construction worker is successfully verified for registration?
faqs.answer: Upon successful verification, the construction worker is registered, and an identity card and passbook are issued to him/her.

faqs.question: What are the fees associated with the registration process?
faqs.answer: The registration fee is ₹20/-, and the yearly subscription fee is ₹30/-. These amounts are noted in the passbook, and a receipt is issued.

faqs.question: How is the yearly subscription fee documented?
faqs.answer: The yearly subscription fee of ₹30/- is recorded in the passbook, and a receipt is issued for the payment.

faqs.question: What is the process for renewing the subscription after one year?
faqs.answer: After the expiry of one year, the subscription of the beneficiary is renewed upon payment of a renewal fee of ₹30/- and submission of an application made in Form-27A.

faqs.question: What happens if the subscription is not renewed after one year?
faqs.answer: If the subscription is not renewed, the registration of the beneficiary is cancelled after the expiry of one year.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary reapply for renewal after cancellation?
faqs.answer: Yes, a fresh application for renewal can be submitted to the Assistant Labour Commissioner (ALC) for consideration.

faqs.question: What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?
faqs.answer: A registered member under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of West Bengal, shall be eligible for this benefit.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is given under this benefit?
faqs.answer: A member is eligible for a reimbursement of upto ₹5,000/- under this benefit.

faqs.question: Where can the prescribed format be collected from?
faqs.answer: The prescribed format which can be collected from Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers in your area.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Submit your welfare scheme application to the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers in your area.

name: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Old Age Assistance Scheme
description: The scheme “The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Old Age Assistance Scheme” is implemented by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands to provide financial assistance to senior citizens (Above 60 years of age) in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The aim of the scheme is to provide social security by way of financial assistance to destitute, senior citizens who are without any means of subsistence and having no one to give financial support to them for their livelihood. As per the scheme, only those who are permanent residents of A&N Islands or having resided in this territory for not less than 10 years immediately preceding the date of applications are eligible for receiving financial assistance.
benefits: The amount of assistance for persons in the age group 60-79 years shall be ₹2
500/- per month.The amount of assistance for persons aged 80 years & above shall be ₹3

000/-.Note 01: The scheme also included the beneficiaries of the Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (IGNOAPS).Note 02: Payment of allowance shall be made through Bank Account on a monthly basis.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided in the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands for more than 10 years at the time of making the application.The age of the applicant should be 60 years or above.The household income of the applicant does not exceed ₹4000/- per month.The applicant should not be receiving any other financial assistance
pension
or grant from the government or any other source.

if applicableBank account details/Copy of passbookProof of income issued by the competent authorityAny other document as required

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of the scheme is to provide social security by way of financial assistance to destitute, senior citizens who are without any means of subsistence and having no one to give financial support to them for their livelihood.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible individuals must be permanent residents of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided there for at least 10 years preceding the application date.

faqs.answer: Applicants must be 60 years or older, with a household income not exceeding ₹4000 per month. They should not be receiving any other financial assistance or pension.

name: Pension Benefit for the Construction Worker
description: The "Pension Benefit for the Construction Workers" by the Sikkim Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, pension to the registered beneficiaries of the Board who have completed the age of 60 years.
benefits: 000/- is provided for Pension Benefit.
eligibility_criteria: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:The applicant should be a resident of Sikkim.The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.The applicant should have served the Board for at least 90 days in a given year.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Should be a registered member Under the Sikkim Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.Should have completed 60 years of age.Should have been working as a building worker for not less than 5 years after the registration as beneficiary under the board.
required_documents: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:Photographs of the concerned worker.Attested copy of Proof of Age.Attested copy of Address Proof.Details of the establishment where the applicant is working.Proof regarding Submission of Registration fees.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Letter from concerned organization/establishment.Identity Card.Age proof/ Birth Certificate.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Act?
faqs.answer: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The Beneficiary Registering Officer is responsible for registering the worker as a beneficiary under the Act.

faqs.question: What is required for a worker to be registered as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The worker must comply with all the requirements as laid down in the rules. Upon compliance, the Beneficiary Registering Officer will register the worker and issue an identity card with the worker's photograph affixed on it.

faqs.question: What form is used for the identity card issued to registered workers?
faqs.answer: The identity card is issued in Form XXVIII, which is annexed to these rules.

faqs.question: Is there a record of issued identity cards?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Beneficiary Registering Officer maintains a register of the issued identity cards in Form XXIX.

faqs.question: Can a worker appeal a decision made by the Beneficiary Registering Officer?
faqs.answer: Yes, any person may file an appeal to the Board within 30 days against the decision made by the Beneficiary Registering Officer. The decision of the Board is final.

faqs.question: How is the record of registered beneficiaries maintained?
faqs.answer: The Beneficiary Registering Officer maintains a district-wise register of workers registered as beneficiaries in Form XXX.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for filing a nomination?
faqs.answer: The building worker must file a nomination in Form XXXI. The nomination will be revised to include the name of the spouse upon acquiring a family or if there is any legal change in the status of the family.

faqs.question: What is required in the application for a building worker engagement certification?
faqs.answer: The application must include the employer’s certificate confirming the engagement as a building worker.

faqs.question: Is there a fee associated with the application for building worker engagement certification?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application must be accompanied by documents showing payment of a registration fee of ₹20/-.

faqs.question: What is the contribution amount for the fund?
faqs.answer: A beneficiary of the fund shall contribute ₹20/- per month.

faqs.question: How often should the contribution be remitted?
faqs.answer: The contribution should be remitted once every 3 months.

faqs.question: Where should the contribution be remitted?
faqs.answer: The contribution should be remitted in any of the banks specified by the board in the district where the member resides.

faqs.question: What happens if I default on my contribution payments?
faqs.answer: If a beneficiary commits a default in the payment of contribution continuously for a period of one year, they shall cease to be a beneficiary of the fund.

faqs.question: Can I resume my membership if I have defaulted on my contributions?
faqs.answer: Yes, membership may be resumed with the permission of the Secretary of the board or any officer authorized by him. This can be done by paying the arrears of contribution, but such resumption shall not be allowed more than twice.

faqs.question: How many times can I resume my membership after defaulting?
faqs.answer: Membership resumption after defaulting is allowed a maximum of two times, with the permission of the Secretary or an authorized officer and after paying the arrears.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the pension?
faqs.answer: A registered beneficiary who has been working as a building worker for not less than 5 years after registration under these rules shall be eligible for the pension upon completing 60 years of age.

faqs.question: When does the pension become payable?
faqs.answer: The pension becomes payable from the first day of the month following the month in which the beneficiary completes 60 years of age.

faqs.question: How do I apply for the pension?
faqs.answer: An application for the pension must be submitted in Form XXXVII to the Secretary of the Board or an Officer authorized by the Secretary.

faqs.question: What happens after I submit my pension application?
faqs.answer: If the Board determines that you are eligible for the pension, the Board will sanction it, and the Secretary will send the pension sanctioning order to you.

faqs.question: What if my pension application is rejected?
faqs.answer: If your application is rejected, you will be informed within a period of 90 days. You have the right to appeal the decision within 60 days from the date you receive the rejection order.

faqs.question: Can the appeal period be extended?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Board may condone the delay in filing the appeal if there is a sufficient reason provided in writing.

faqs.question: Will I be given a chance to be heard if my application is to be rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes, no application shall be rejected unless the applicant has been given an opportunity of being heard by the Board or an Officer authorized by the Board.

faqs.question: What should I do if I believe I am eligible but my application was rejected?
faqs.answer: You should file an appeal before the Board against the decision within 60 days from the receipt of the rejection order.

faqs.question: Where can I obtain Form XXXVII for the application?
faqs.answer: Form XXXVII can be obtained from the Board’s office or their official website: https://labour.sikkim.gov.in/Uploads/Bocw/8F1D404A-3EC3-4DA9-A4D6-75880B26D191.pdf

faqs.question: Which Department of the NCT of Delhi administers this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is administered by the Labour Department, of the National Capital Territory of Delhi.

faqs.answer: The URL of the Official Website of the Delhi Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board is: https://bocw.delhi.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What is the URL for the registration of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicants needs to register through clicking on the “Register” button on DBoCWWB website: https://dbocwwb.delhi.gov.in/cwapp/MyLoginPage?ReturnUrl=%2Fcwapp%2F

faqs.question: In case of change, how does the worker update their registered Mobile number on the website?
faqs.answer: The facility to amend a worker's registered mobile number on the new DBoCWWB Website is still under process. However, workers who are migrating their membership from E-District Website to the new DBoCWWB Website have an option to update/revise their mobile numbers in the migration form.

faqs.question: What is a Construction Certificate/Labour Card?
faqs.answer:
As an enrolled member with BoCW Welfare Board, the worker will receive a Construction Certificate popularly known as the Labour Card. A Construction Certificate/Labour Card is a document with the worker’s personal details like DoB, Address, Registration Number, Date of Registration along with details of the next date of renewal.
The Construction Certificate/Labour Card is to be shown when applying for any of the claims under the BoCW Act. It is important for the worker to renew their Construction Certificate/Labour Card in order to remain active members. This renewal must be undertaken on a yearly basis.

faqs.question: I am from another state but working as a construction worker in Delhi, can | get registered?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Construction Worker native to any place in India, but working in Delhi can register with the DBoCWWB. The Construction Workers must own an Aadhar Card from any place in India and should have a Proof of Residence of staying in Delhi.

faqs.question: Can members in my family also register if they are all registered construction workers?
faqs.answer: Yes, if there are more than one member in the family who are engaged in Construction Work, they can all register under the DBoCWWB.

faqs.question: Is there a specific age requirement for construction workers to be eligible for registration?
faqs.answer: Yes, construction workers must be at least 18 years old but not more than 65 years old to be eligible for registration under Section 12 of the Main Act.

faqs.question: What is the duration of engagement required for construction workers to qualify for registration?
faqs.answer: Construction workers must have engaged in building or other construction work for a minimum of 90 days during the preceding 12 months to qualify for registration under Section 12 of the Main Act.

faqs.question: What is the Registration/Renewal fee?
faqs.answer: Registration : ₹ 25/-and Renewal : ₹ 20/- and ₹ 2/- per month (late fee).

faqs.question: How can one track the status of my Application on the Website?
faqs.answer: To track, the worker can use the track feature available on the website's landing page. Choose the “Type of Service’ availed, i.e, whether the application was for Registration/Renewal/Claims/Amendment. In the white box, enter the application number mentioned in the acknowledgment receipt. Click Track Application now and a pop-up box will indicate the current status of the Application.

faqs.question: What consequences a worker may face if he/she does not renew the card?
faqs.answer: If a worker does not renew the card, he will not be eligible for the benefit in future, but with the permission of the authorized officer, the membership can be returned with the outstanding amount, though this facility will not be available more than 2 times.

name: Farmer Suicide Ex-Gratia
description: "Farmer Suicide Ex-Gratia" is a Financial Assistance Scheme by the Agriculture & Cooperation Dept. of the Govt. of Andhra Pradesh. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 7,00,000 to the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers, who commit suicide due to agrarian reasons as a rehabilitation package to support the families of the farmers. The reasons for committing such suicides may be the Failure of Bore wells, Raising of Commercial crops with the high cost of cultivation, Non-Remunerative Prices, etc.

000 to the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers

who commit suicide due to agrarian reasons.A Point of Contact at the Collector’s office of the rank of Superintendent shall be designated as in charge of farmer suicide cases and assistance to victim families.In the process of Rehabilitation

benefits of other Government schemes should be provided on a priority basis to the family members of the deceased farmer as per the eligibility.A Special Grievance Day shall be held at the Collectorate once a month for farmers to cover all issues of farmers including farmer suicide
distress
Government schemes
and land issues.
eligibility_criteria: The deceased farmer should have been a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.The cause of death of the farmer should be suicide.The reason for the suicide should be an agrarian reason
such as Failure of Bore wells
Raising of Commercial crops with a high cost of cultivation
Non-Remunerative Prices
Oral tenancy
and ineligibility to avail of Bank Loans
Private lending with higher interest rates
Adverse seasonal conditions
Heavy expenditure incurred towards Children education
ill health
and marriages.The term “farmer” shall include every person who derives substantial livelihood from farming
not limited to those with title to land
but including tenant farmers and women farmers.The beneficiary of the financial assistance should be a family member of the deceased farmer.
required_documents: Residential/Domicile CertificatePassport Size PhotoEx -gratia proposals with the recommendations of the District Collector (Letter to be addressed to the Special Commissioner of Agriculture by the District Collector) Mandal Level and Divisional Level three-member committee report.Aadhar Card Ration Card Death Panchanama Post Mortem Report Death Certificate FIR Copy Xerox Copies of the Promissory Notes Details of the Legal Heir along with Bank Details duly certified by the Tahsildar for Direct Benefit Transfer.If the suicide is committed by a tenant farmer
documentary evidence of the lease such as Revenue Records
or Crop Cultivators Rights Card (CCRC).

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance That The Family Of The Deceased Farmer Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹ 7,00,000 to the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers.

faqs.question: Which Reasons Can Be Considered Agrarian Reasons For Suicide?
faqs.answer: The reason agrarian reasons for the suicides can be: Failure of Bore wells, Raising of Commercial crops with a high cost of cultivation, Non-Remunerative Prices, Oral tenancy, ineligibility to avail of Bank Loans, Private lending with higher interest rates, Adverse seasonal conditions, Heavy expenditure incurred towards Children education, ill health, and marriages.

faqs.question: How Is The Term “Farmer” Defined For The Purpose Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The term “farmer” shall include every person who derives substantial livelihood from farming, not limited to those with title to land, but including tenant farmers and women farmers.

faqs.question: In Whose Bank Account Can The Amount Of The Financial Assistance Be Disbursed?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary of the financial assistance should be a family member of the deceased farmer.

faqs.question: What Is The Purpose Of The Helpline In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Any farmer or a friend, relative, family member, or well-wisher may bring to the notice of the Collector, any situation of extreme distress of a farmer or the livelihood of such extreme act by making use of the helpline at the Collectorate. Such information shall be flashed from the Collectorate to Division Office and Mandal office immediately and the RDO and his staff will get in touch with that family immediately and organize appropriate counseling at the District level and work out a package to insulate them from the pressures of money lenders.

faqs.question: How Can The Family Of The Deceased Farmer Be Safeguarded From The Moneylenders?
faqs.answer: The RDO and his staff will get in touch with that family immediately and organize appropriate counseling at the District level and work out a package to insulate them from the pressures of money lenders.

faqs.question: Who Can Inform The Collectorate About The Situation Of Extreme Distress Of A Farmer?
faqs.answer: Any farmer or a friend, relative, family member, or well-wisher may bring to the notice of the Collector, any situation of extreme distress of a farmer or the livelihood of such extreme act by making use of the helpline at the Collectorate.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Objective Of The "Special Grievance Day"?
faqs.answer: The Special Grievance Day shall be held at the Collectorate once a month for farmers to cover all issues of farmers including farmer suicide, distress, Government schemes, and land issues.

faqs.question: When Was The Government Order Of The Scheme Guidelines First Issued?
faqs.answer: The Government Order of the Scheme Guidelines was first issued on 14th October 2019.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objectives of this scheme are to support the family members of the deceased farmers/tenant farmers, who commit suicide due to agrarian reasons.

faqs.question: Who Shall Be The Point Of Contact At The Collector’s Office In Case Of Suicide By A Farmer?
faqs.answer: A Point of Contact at the Collector’s office of the rank of Superintendent shall be designated as in charge of farmer suicide cases and assistance to victim families.

faqs.question: How Will The Suicide By The Farmer Affect His/Her Family's Prioritization For The Government Schemes?
faqs.answer: In the process of Rehabilitation, benefits of other Government schemes should be provided on a priority basis to the family members of the deceased farmer as per the eligibility.

faqs.question: By When Is The District Collector Expected To Visit The Place Of Occurrence And For What Purposes?
faqs.answer: The District Collector shall visit the place of occurrence along with Agriculture and Revenue department officials to extend moral support and initiate further necessary action.

faqs.question: What Additional Documents Are Required In Case The Suicide Is Committed By A Tenant Farmer?
faqs.answer: If the suicide is committed by a tenant farmer, documentary evidence of the lease such as Revenue Records, or Crop Cultivators Rights Card (CCRC).

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Composition Of The Mandal Level Committee?
faqs.answer:
The Mandal Level Committee shall comprise the following: 
• Tahsildar : Chairman. 
• Agricultural Officer: Convener. 
• Sub-Inspector of Police: Member.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Composition Of The Division-Level Level Committee?
faqs.answer:
The Division-level Three Member Committee comprises the  following: 
• R.D.O./Sub Collector: Chairman. 
• Asst. Director of Agriculture (concerned): Convener. 
• Deputy Superintendent of Police (concerned): Member.

faqs.question: By When Should The Mandal-Level Committee Furnish Their Preliminary Report To The Divisional Level Committee?
faqs.answer: Mandal-level Committee shall visit the place of occurrence of farmer suicide, conduct an inquiry and furnish their preliminary report to the Divisional Level Committee within 24 hours positively.

faqs.question: Which Department Manages This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by the Agriculture & Cooperation Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme A “One Family, One Benefit” Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no such mention in the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Are There Any Age-Related Criteria For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no age-related criteria mentioned in the scheme guidelines for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can A Domicile Of Telangana Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, in order to be eligible to apply, the applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme State Sponsored Or Centrally Sponsored?
faqs.answer: This scheme is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme.

name: Mukhyamantri Samajik Samrasta Antarjatiya Vivah Shagun Yojana
description: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Samajik Samrasta Antarjatiya Vivah Shagun Yojana” is implemented by the Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana to promote communal harmony by encouraging inter-caste marriages. The objective of the scheme is in diminishing caste consciousness among the people and to encourage inter-caste marriages. This scheme is effective from 01.04.1983. Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,50,000/- is given to the couple when a Non-Scheduled Caste boy or girl marries a Scheduled Caste girl/boy. The amount is provided as an incentive to the married couple and deposited in the joint account of the couple for 3 years lock-in period. This is a 50:50 sharing basis scheme of the Government of India/State Government.

000/- will be deposited in the couple's joint fixed deposit account for a lock-in period of 3 years
without the facility for its pre-mature encashment.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Bill Collector in the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: The Bill Collector is responsible for disbursing the pension to eligible individuals on the first date of every month and maintaining the ward-wise register of eligible persons.

faqs.question: How does the Municipal Commissioner contribute to the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: The Municipal Commissioner scrutinizes the eligibility of recommended applicants, sanctions pensions, and issues cheques to Bill Collectors for disbursement.

faqs.question: How are existing pensioners and new applicants categorized under the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: Existing pensioners are listed in Part A of the ward-wise register, while new eligible persons are listed in Part B, maintained by the Bill Collector.

faqs.question: What happens after the Municipal Commissioner sanctions the pension under the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: Once sanctioned, the Project Director (DRDA) sends the pension acquittance list and funds to the Municipal Commissioner, who then issues cheques to the Bill Collector for disbursement.

faqs.question: How often is the pension disbursed under the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: The pension is disbursed monthly, specifically on the first date of every month, to eligible individuals.

faqs.question: What is the role of DWCUA office bearers in the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: DWCUA office bearers are present during the disbursement of pensions to ensure transparency and proper distribution to eligible individuals.

faqs.question: Can individuals covered under other pension schemes apply for the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must not be covered under any other pension scheme to be eligible for the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for applicants under the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be 65 years of age or older to qualify for the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme.

faqs.question: What does it mean to be "destitute" under the INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Urban) scheme?
faqs.answer: Being destitute means having little or no means of subsistence and no family or relatives to depend upon for support.

A sum of ₹2,750/- per month per family is provided to the families who have solely girl child/children.
