faqs.question: What is the "Ladli Social Security Allowance Scheme"?
faqs.answer: The scheme "Ladli Social Security Allowance Scheme scheme" is based on the pattern of an old age allowance scheme and under this scheme, a sum of ₹2750/- per month, per family will be given by the state government to those families who have solely girl child/children.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Social Justice And Empowerment, Government of Haryana

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 1st January 2006.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Any family where biological single parent/parents are domicile of Haryana or working for the Government of Haryana and have no son, biological or adopted, but only daughter/daughters are eligible to get benefits.

faqs.question: Can a general category applicant be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of applicants.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, a sum of ₹2750/- per month, per family will be given by the state government to those families who have solely girl child/children.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The enrolment of families under this scheme commences from the 45th birthday of the mother or the father.

faqs.question: For how many years the applicant will get the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits will be provided for 15 years from the date of girls' parents completed 45 years of age.

faqs.question: Who will receive the financial assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Initially, the mother will receive financial assistance. In case the mother is not surviving, the benefit will be paid to the father.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The gross annual income from all sources of the family must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- to be eligible for getting benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Who is excluded from the scheme?
faqs.answer: The guardian or any parent of the child is employed by any Government or by any Local/Statutory Body or any organization substantially financed by any Government or Local/Statutory Body or who is drawing pension or family pension therefrom will not be eligible under the scheme.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply through both online & offline modes.

faqs.question: Where can an applicant find the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form may be downloaded from the official website of the department. https://socialjusticehry.gov.in/form/application-form-for-ladli-social-security-allowance/

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the applicant should visit the Official Portal -Antyodaya-SARAL Portal. https://saralharyana.gov.in/

name: PVTGs Dakia Yojana (Chief Minister's Food Security Scheme)
description: The "PVTGs Dakia Yojana (Chief Minister's Food Security Scheme)" by the Welfare Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to ensure food security for Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs). Under this scheme, subsidized food grains are provided to PVTG families to improve their living conditions.
benefits: Food Security for PTG Families:Free provision of 35 kg of wheat and rice per family per month at ₹1 per kg.﻿Direct Village-Level Distribution:Food grains are distributed at the village level by Block Welfare Officers.﻿Support for National Food Security:Complements the "Antyodaya Yojana" by including all PVTG families in Jharkhand.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must belong to Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs).The applicant’s family must be enrolled under the "Antyodaya Yojana."The family should reside in designated PVTG areas or remote locations.
required_documents: Aadhaar Card (If applicable).Ration Card (If applicable).

faqs.question: What is the PVTGs Dakia Yojana?
faqs.answer: The PVTGs Dakia Yojana is a food security initiative launched by the Department of Food, Public Distribution and Consumer Affairs, Government of Jharkhand, to provide subsidized food grains to PVTGs.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Families belonging to Primitive Tribal Groups (PTGs) and enrolled under the "Antyodaya Yojana" are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receive 35 kg of wheat and rice per family per month at a subsidized rate of ₹1 per kg.

faqs.question: Is there any cost to avail of the benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the food grains are provided free of cost to eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How is the food distributed to beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Food grains are distributed at the village level by the Block Welfare Officers. Beneficiaries are notified in advance about the distribution schedule.

faqs.question: How can I apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant can apply from the Block Welfare Office, completing it with the necessary details, and submitting it along with the required documents.

faqs.question: Are there any exclusions under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, families not belonging to PVTGs or not enrolled under the Antyodaya Yojana are excluded from the scheme.

faqs.question: How is the scheme monitored?
faqs.answer: The scheme is monitored by the District Welfare Officers and the Tribal Welfare Commissioner. Regular audits and reports ensure transparency.

faqs.question: What happens if a beneficiary family is unable to collect food grains?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can inform the Block Welfare Office in advance. Arrangements may be made for an authorized person to collect the grains on their behalf.

faqs.question: How frequently are food grains distributed under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Food grains are distributed every month, with each family entitled to 35 kg of wheat and rice.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of the U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu?
faqs.answer: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The officer authorized by the Board is responsible for registering the worker as a beneficiary under the Act.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Fund?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of eighteen and sixty and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than ninety days during the preceding twelve months is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Fund under this Act.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for registration?
faqs.answer: Application for registration is to be made in the prescribed form and is to be accompanied by prescribed documents and a fee of not more than fifty rupees.

faqs.question: Where should the application for registration be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application for registration has to be made to the officer authorized by the Board.

faqs.question: What is the registration fee for becoming a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Fund?
faqs.answer: The registration fee is not more than fifty rupees.

faqs.question: Is there a specific form for the registration application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for registration must be made in the prescribed form. You can obtain this form from the authorized officer of the Board.

faqs.question: What form needs to be used to apply for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: The application must be made in the prescribed Form-II.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Submit your welfare scheme application to the Member Secretary of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (BOCWWB).

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Health and Maternity Cover?
faqs.answer: Any registered members of the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of the U.T. Administration of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu are eligible to avail the benefits.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on the number of children for whom benefits can be availed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant shall be eligible to avail the benefits only for their first two children.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is ₹30,000/- per delivery for registered male members and ₹40,000/- per delivery for registered female members.

faqs.question: What other benefits are available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries shall be enrolled under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojna, also known as "Ayushman Bharat."

name: Danveer Bhamashah Honors- Chhattisgarh
description: The scheme "Danveer Bhamashah Honors" is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh, aims to encourage the spirit of charity, harmony, patriotism, sacrifice, and cultural devotion among all sections of the society in the state. The state government has decided to give it to encourage the contributions of outstanding individuals/organizations that provide charity, hospitality, and exemplary assistance in the state of Chhattisgarh.Objectives:The purpose of this honor is to encourage patriotism, sacrifice, and cultural devotion in the state through the spirit of charity and harmony among all sections of the society. Along with this, public participation has to be promoted in permanent social service works so that a good environment of social consciousness can develop in the state. This honor will be given to an outstanding person/organization for such remarkable work.
benefits: An award amount of ₹1

000/- along with a certificate of appreciation will be granted to the recipient.Note: The person/officer of the organization selected for the award will be eligible to receive a traveling allowance equivalent to a Grade-A level officer of the government along with an assistant to attend the function.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant/organization should be a resident of/established in Chhattisgarh.There should be a long-term involvement in permanent works of charity
patriotism

and social service within the state.The past work of the individual/organization should be outstanding and continuously active at present in that area. Result-oriented continuity is essential.The contribution of the individual/organization should reflect a wider impact in the respective field of work. It should be clearly reflected to what extent and how intensively innovation

i.e. new methods and new areas have been adopted by moving away from the traditional methods.The entry of an organization or individual whose official is a member of that year's award jury will not be considered.An organization or individual who has received an award in the field of charity in the last 5 years will also be eligible for this award.The assessment for the award will consider both the past and present work of the individual/organization.Government/semi-government institutions or their employees will not be eligible for the honor.Only continuous upliftment work
free from conflicts and supported by proper evidence
will be considered.Note 1: If the government or the jury receives the proposal through any other means
the decision for the award can be taken after obtaining an opinion from the concerned district as per requirement.Note 2: In case the entry received by any organization/person is not selected
the original entry can be returned to the concerned organization/person through the district administration.Note 3: Normally
only one person or organization will be selected for the award. However
if the jury deems it necessary
two persons or organizations may be selected

and the prize money will be divided equally between them.Note 4: Not being selected once will not mean that the work of the concerned person/organization is not award-worthy. Individuals/institutions fulfilling the prescribed criteria will be able to submit entries again in subsequent years.
required_documents: Complete introduction of the person/organization.Detailed information about the work done in the field of charity and nationalism.Details of any other award
if any
received.If any report has been published regarding excellent work

then its details and a photocopy of the published report.Photocopies/true copies of comments made by eminent persons and newspapers and magazines etc. regarding the excellent work done in the field of charity and nationalism.Recommendation of the District President regarding the continuous and undisputed functioning of the institution/person.No objection regarding direct assessment of the works of the institution/individual by the jury or any of its members or authorized person.In case of selection

written consent of the person/organization to receive the award.Any subsequent correspondence other than the facts/information contained in the entry will not be considered for the prize.Any other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the award?
faqs.answer: The main objective is to promote patriotism, sacrifice, cultural devotion, and social consciousness in Chhattisgarh through the recognition of individuals or organizations that have made remarkable contributions to charity and social service.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the award?
faqs.answer: Any individual or organization that is a resident of or established in Chhattisgarh and has a long-term involvement in charity, patriotism, and social service within the state is eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Can government or semi-government institutions apply for the award?
faqs.answer: No, government or semi-government institutions and their employees are not eligible for this honor.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of receiving the Danveer Bhamashah Honors?
faqs.answer: The recipient receives an award of ₹1,00,000/- and a certificate of appreciation. Additionally, the person or officer representing the organization will receive a traveling allowance equivalent to a Grade-A level officer.

faqs.question: Can past award recipients apply for the Danveer Bhamashah Honors?
faqs.answer: Yes, individuals or organizations that have received an award in the field of charity in the last five years are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of awards given each year?
faqs.answer: Typically, only one person or organization is selected for the award each year. However, if deemed necessary by the jury, two awards may be given, with the prize money equally divided.

faqs.question: How is the award recipient selected?
faqs.answer: The recipient is selected based on recommendations from the District Collector, and the final decision is made by a State Level Jury.

faqs.question: Where should the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted to the Joint/Deputy Director, Social Welfare Department, at the District Office.

faqs.question: Can an organization reapply if it wasn’t selected the previous year?
faqs.answer: Yes, organizations or individuals that meet the criteria can submit their applications again in subsequent years.

faqs.question: Will the original application be returned if not selected?
faqs.answer: Yes, if the entry is not selected, the original application can be returned to the concerned organization or individual through the district administration.

faqs.question: When and where is the award distribution ceremony held?
faqs.answer: The award distribution ceremony is organized by the government at a fixed place and date, which will be announced after the selection.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the scheme?

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is open to unorganized transport workers aged 18-60 years who operate commercial vehicles in West Bengal.

faqs.question: What is the pension amount provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Nominee/ Dependent receives a pension amount equal to 50% of the amount last drawn by the beneficiary.

faqs.question: What happens to the pension after the death of the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: After the beneficiary’s death, the Nominee/ Dependent receives 50% of the pension amount that the beneficiary was receiving.

faqs.question: Can individuals below 60 years of age receive a pension?
faqs.answer: In cases of total permanent disability, the scheme provides a monthly pension of ₹750/- to eligible beneficiaries under 60 years of age.

faqs.question: What types of vehicles are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme applies to commercial vehicles such as taxis, auto-rickshaws, buses, trucks, vans, tempos, and other similar vehicles.

faqs.question: Are vehicles used solely for personal or family purposes eligible?
faqs.answer: No, vehicles solely used for personal or family purposes are not eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: How are pension benefits disbursed?
faqs.answer: Pension benefits are directly transferred to the bank accounts of the beneficiaries through the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) system.

faqs.question: Can female transport workers apply for this scheme?

faqs.question: Where can workers seek additional information or assistance regarding the scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers can contact the respective Regional Labor Offices or Labor Welfare Facilitation Centers in their area for more details.

name: Transgender Utthan Kosh – Identity Card for Transgender

If a transgender person applies for the ID card independently through the online portal, they can receive the payment directly into their account upon presenting their own card.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides transgender individuals with official identity cards recognizing their self-identified gender.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the identity card?
faqs.answer: Any transgender individual residing in Rajasthan can apply.

faqs.question: Is medical examination required for identity verification?
faqs.answer: No, the identity card is issued based on self-declaration.

faqs.question: What documents are required for the application?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to submit an affidavit, residential proof, and a passport-sized photograph.

faqs.question: Where should the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted at the District Collector’s Office.

faqs.question: Is there an application fee?
faqs.answer: No, there is no fee for applying for the identity card.

faqs.question: How long does it take to receive the identity card?
faqs.answer: The identity card is issued within 15 working days after verification.

faqs.question: How will the applicant be informed of a rejection?

faqs.question: Can a rejected applicant reapply?

faqs.question: How long does the re-evaluation process take?
faqs.answer: The revised application review process should be completed within 30 working days.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for applying?

faqs.question: Who supervises the issuance of the identity card?

name: Pension Scheme to Old Age Persons (Senior Citizen)

The scheme aims to support senior citizens in meeting their basic needs during old age. It is specifically targeted at residents of Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu who are 60 years and above, with an annual family income not exceeding ₹1.5 lakh per annum. Under this scheme, eligible individuals aged 60–69 years receive a monthly pension of ₹1,500/-, while those aged 70 years and above receive ₹2,000/- per month.

000/-.Note: The mode of fund transfer shall be Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: What is the objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide financial support to senior citizens to help them meet their basic needs.

faqs.question: Who implements this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, UT of Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu.

faqs.question: Is this a one-time benefit or a recurring pension?
faqs.answer: This is a monthly pension provided to eligible senior citizens.

faqs.question: What is the pension amount?
faqs.answer: The beneficiaries aged 60–69 years receive ₹1,500 per month, while those aged 70 years and above receive ₹2,000 per month.

faqs.question: How is the pension amount distributed?
faqs.answer: The pension is disbursed directly into the beneficiary's bank account through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Any resident of Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu who is 60 years or older and has an annual family income of ₹1.5 lakh or less is eligible.

faqs.question: Is there any domicile requirement for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant must be a domicile of Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu.

faqs.question: Can a senior citizen receiving another old-age pension apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants should not be receiving financial assistance under any other old-age pension scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any requirement regarding financial status?
faqs.answer: Yes, the annual family income of the applicant must not exceed ₹1,50,000.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?

faqs.question: Are there any specific provisions for persons with disabilities under this scheme?

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance disbursed to the beneficiary?

name: RMEWF-Financial Assistance For Ex-Servicemen In Penury
description: A scheme to provide financial assistance to non-pensioner Ex-Servicemen up to rank of Havildar /equivalent and their widows who are living in extreme poverty.﻿The aim of this aid-gratis Penury grant was to provide a measure of relief to destitute non-pensioner Ex-Servicemen up to rank of Havildar/equivalent and their widows.﻿﻿﻿
benefits: A financial assistance of Rs.4000/- per month is paid Annually to the eligible Ex-Servicemen or their widows .﻿NoteThe financial assistance is non-transferable and will cease automatically upon death of the ESM or widow. After expiry of ESM
his widow will have to apply afresh for financial assistance under penury.
eligibility_criteria: The eligibility criteria for availing financial assistance under this scheme are as follows:-﻿Must be a non-pensioner ESM or his widow.Should be of rank Havildar/equivalent from the Navy/AF and below.The ESM/widow should be 65 years of age on 01 Apr of the Financial Year in which applying.After demise of ESM who was already availing the Penury Grant
his widow is eligible for Penury grant irrespective of her age at the time of the death of ESM. Therefore
in such cases
the condition of Widow to have attained the age of 65 years in not applicable﻿
required_documents: Scanned copies of following documents need to be uploaded while filling online application:-﻿Service Document/Discharge Book of ESM (Mandatory to upload all pages of Discharge Book in a sequential manner without missing any pages and without any alterations). The pages uploaded must be in legible condition. Any cutting/overwriting in discharge book must be authenticated by the DSWO. Signatures and Stamp marks of any other authority except DSWO will render the entry null and void.Age proof

if date of birth not given in the Service Document / Discharge Book.Identity Card of ESM / Widows issued by Zonal Sainik Board.First page of Bank Pass book and a cancelled cheque in case details of Bank A/c Number

IFS Code and account holder’s personal particulars are not given in first page of Bank Pass book.Copy of Aadhar Card.Certificate of penury to state that the applicant does not have any source of income signed by Sarpanch/ Patwari/ BDO (revenue officials) affixed with his rubber stamp & round seal. A specimen of "Certificate of Penury” is available on https://ksb.gov.in/writereaddata/DownLoad/Penury_Certificate.pdf ﻿

name: Cash Prizes Scheme (BBOCWWB)
description: "Cash Prizes Scheme" was launched by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (BBOCWWB), Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar. Students securing 60% or more in the 10th and 12th exams receive cash prizes of up to ₹25,000/- per year. Upto two children of a registered construction worker are eligible.
benefits: On securing 80% or more in the 10th or 12th examination: ₹25
000/- per year.On securing 70% to 79.99% in the 10th or 12th examination: ₹15
000/- per year.On securing 60% to 69.99% in the 10th or 12th examination: ₹10
000/- per year.
eligibility_criteria: For the WorkerThe worker should be engaged in building or construction work.The worker should be registered with the "Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board".The worker's membership with the Welfare Board must be active at the time of application.The worker should have at least one year of membership with the Board.A maximum of two children of the registered construction worker will be eligible for the benefit.For the ChildThe child should have passed the 10th or 12th examination conducted by a board in Bihar.The child should have scored 60% or above in the examination.
required_documents: Identity Proof i.e. Aadhaar Card
Voter CardBank Account DetailsProof of AgeIdentity Card of the Registered WorkerMarksheet of StudentProof of MembershipAny Other Documents as Required

faqs.question: What support does the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board provide for students who score well in their board exams?
faqs.answer: The Board offers cash prizes ranging from ₹10,000 to ₹25,000 per year for children of registered construction workers who secure 60% or above in their 10th or 12th board examinations in Bihar.

faqs.question: How much cash prize is awarded to students who score above 80% in their board exams?
faqs.answer: Students securing 80% or more in their 10th or 12th examinations are eligible for a cash prize of ₹25,000 per year.

faqs.question: Can all children of a registered construction worker apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only up to two children of a registered construction worker are eligible for this benefit.

faqs.question: What is the minimum percentage required to be eligible for the cash prize scheme?
faqs.answer: Students must secure a minimum of 60% marks in their 10th or 12th examination to be eligible for the cash prize scheme.

faqs.question: How long must a worker be registered with the Welfare Board to avail this benefit?
faqs.answer: The worker must have at least one year of membership with the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What is the cash prize amount for students scoring between 70% to 79.99%?
faqs.answer: Students scoring between 70% to 79.99% in their 10th or 12th examination are eligible for a cash prize of ₹15,000 per year.

faqs.question: How can applicants track the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Applicants can track their application status online on the official website by entering their registration number.

faqs.question: What is the cash prize amount for students scoring between 60% to 69.99%?
faqs.answer: Students scoring between 60% to 69.99% in their 10th or 12th examination receive a cash prize of ₹10,000 per year.

faqs.question: How do I apply for the scheme after completing the registration process?
faqs.answer: Visit the official website, click on "Scheme Application," select "Apply for Scheme," enter your registration number, and complete the application form with required documents.

faqs.question: Can a construction worker apply without being registered with the Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: No, the worker must be registered with the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: What type of work should the applicant be engaged in to be eligible?
faqs.answer: The worker should be specifically engaged in building or construction work.

faqs.question: Are applicants required to pay any fee during the registration process?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants must pay an application fee online during the registration process.

faqs.question: Is it necessary to fill all fields marked with an asterisk (*) in the registration form?
faqs.answer: Yes, all fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory and must be filled in.

faqs.question: Can students who scored below 60% apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, students must score a minimum of 60% or above to be eligible for the cash prize scheme.

name: Workers In Case Of His Partial Permanent Disablement-JKBOCWWB
description: The "Workers In Case of Partial Permanent Disablement" scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, under the MUHAFIZ Scheme (PMJJBY: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana, PMSBY: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana) from 01.01.2018, provides Rs. 1,00,000 to registered BOC workers in the case of partial permanent disablement.
benefits: Under the scheme
Rs. 1
000 is provided to registered BOC workers in case of partial permanent disablement.
eligibility_criteria: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:The applicant should be a resident of Jammu & Kashmir.The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.The applicant should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days during the preceding 12 months.The applicant should be registration is renewed annually.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:The worker must be a registered member of the Building and Other Construction Workers (BOC) Welfare Board.The scheme applies to workers who suffer from partial permanent disablement.
required_documents: Original Medical Certificate issued by the Medical Board or competent authority.Attested Age Proof of the registered worker.Duly attested photocopy of Bank Passbook of the worker or nominee/legal heir

or a cancelled cheque bearing the name of the worker/nominee/legal heir and IFSC code of the bank branch.Photocopy of Aadhaar Card/Biometric Card of the registered worker.Registration Certificate of the worker under the BOC Welfare Board.Proof of employment in the building/construction sector (work records or pay slips).Disability Certificate from a recognized medical authority confirming the partial permanent disablement.Proof of residence (Voter ID
Ration Card
Utility Bill
etc.) for address verification.Photograph of the worker (passport size).Income Certificate to establish eligibility under the scheme (if applicable).

faqs.question: What is the "Workers In Case of Partial Permanent Disablement" scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme provides financial assistance to registered Building and Other Construction (BOC) workers in the case of partial permanent disablement.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the partial permanent disablement scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered BOC worker who suffers from partial permanent disablement is eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the amount of financial assistance provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of Rs. 1,00,000 to the eligible worker.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Key documents include a Medical Certificate from a competent authority, Age Proof, Aadhaar Card, Bank Passbook, and a Disability Certificate.

faqs.question: Where can the worker apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The worker can apply through the nearest BOC Welfare Board office in Jammu & Kashmir.

faqs.question: Is the Aadhaar Card mandatory for applying?
faqs.answer: Yes, a photocopy of the Aadhaar Card or Biometric Card is required for both the registered worker and the nominee/legal heir.

faqs.question: How is the disability confirmed for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The disability must be certified by a Medical Board or a competent medical authority.

faqs.question: Can a nominee/legal heir apply on behalf of the worker?
faqs.answer: Yes, if the worker is unable to apply, a nominee or legal heir can apply with the necessary documents, including their own Aadhaar and bank details.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for the worker to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The worker should be within the eligible working age as per the registration guidelines of the BOC Welfare Board.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable for accidental disablement?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme specifically covers partial permanent disablement due to other causes, not accidents.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance disbursed to the worker?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is directly credited to the registered bank account of the worker or nominee.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable to workers in sectors other than construction?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is specifically for workers registered under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
